description:
CI2T est l'unité d'ingénierie au service de la performance des parcs de production d'EDF. Elle rassemble les métiers de l'ingénierie thermique bas carbone et ceux du système/transport électrique. Ses 550 salariés, hommes et femmes, œuvrent pour offrir de nouvelles solutions destinées à compenser l'intermittence du mix-énergétique et continuer à satisfaire ses 80 clients et partenaires en France et dans plus de 30 pays.
Au croisement d’enjeux essentiels et captivants, rejoignez un groupe à la dimension internationale, champion de la croissance bas carbone et activement engagé dans la lutte contre le réchauffement climatique !
Rejoindre EDF, c’est également travailler dans un Groupe porteur de valeurs fortes, qui innove avec de solides actifs industriels et vous confie des missions qui ont du sens.
Découvrez en images nos orientations et nos valeurs sur la chaine Youtube EDF –>
https://www.youtube.com/user/EDFCommunitymanager.
Vous travaillerez sur le site EDF de Cap Ampère à Saint Denis dans le pôle e-monitoring, (composé de 12 personnes), du Département appui aux parcs de production.
Vous contribuerez à l’analyse de données et process pour le fonctionnement de centrales de
production thermique.
Vos missions :
Vous surveillerez la performance des centrales de production.
Pour cela, vous travaillerez à la fois sur l’aspect physique, en construisant des jumeaux numériques du fonctionnement de ces centrales, et à la fois sur l’aspect d’analyse des signaux remontés.
Vous construirez des modèles thermodynamiques qui permettent de comparer la performance réelle avec la performance attendue.
Vous construirez aussi des modèles statistiques pour être capable de détecter des anomalies pouvant impacter la production.
Vous aurez à terme responsabilité d’un site de production complet, ferez le lien entre le pôle est les experts métiers, devrez vous assurer de la cohérence de la surveillance de votre site et avec les autres.
Conformément aux engagements pris par EDF SA en faveur de l’accueil et de l’intégration des personnes en situation de handicap, cet emploi est ouvert à toutes et à tous, sous réserve de l’accord de la médecine du travail.
Diplômé d’école d'ingénieur ou de master dans le domaine de la thermodynamique/mécanique
Vous avez une expérience avec la programmation, les scripts ou les progiciels statistiques (Python, R, Matlab, SQL)
ou une expérience / formation en modélisation de système physique ou en thermodynamique.
Selon votre diplôme et votre expérience professionnelle, une rémunération comprise entre 42 et 46K€ vous sera proposée.
EDF vous offre également les avantages suivants : possibilité de logement, intéressement, possibilité d’épargne salariale (PEG, PERCO), prime individuelle de performance, bonus collectif…).

description:
Role Summary
DataForce by TransPerfect is seeking a freelance Project Support Engineer to work on one of our video data projects in Paris, France. This role will be a hybrid of remote and onsite work, with the onsite work being regularly necessary to troubleshoot and address technical issues. Our Support Engineer will be required to have excellent English skills as well as technical experience in MacOS, iOS and Android systems, the ability to run Python scripts and skills in tabulation.
Job requirements
Role Responsibilities:
Station Monitoring: monitoring the progress of each of three stations set up at our project site, ensuring that tasks assigned are being executed according to the project plan.
Troubleshooting and Onsite Intervention: maintaining the devices at the office and troubleshooting issues using step-by-step guidelines both remotely and, where needed.
Communication and Reporting: facilitating communication and collaboration among internal team members and external project participants, ensuring that any downtime is accounted for and status updates are regularly provided on each station.
Station Uptime Management: following designed timeline, monitoring dependencies and station uptime to ensure maximum throughput.
Quality Assurance: spot checking videos after recording to ensure that the level of quality meets requirements and intervening in case of any issues.
Role Requirements – Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Location in Paris, France
Excellent English language proficiency
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Tech savvy, ability to follow step-by-step instructions and ability to run Python scripts
Technical experience with MacOS, iOS and Android systems
Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking and problem-solving approach to tasks
Outstanding teamwork and collaboration skills
Role Requirements – Education and/or Experience
Studies in Engineering, Information Technology or similar are a plus
Relevant previous experience e.g. in Tech Support or other roles with similar responsibilities is a plus
Who we are
DataForce is a worldwide data collection and labeling platform that combines technology with a diverse network of more than one million data contributors, scientists, and engineers. DataForce offers companies in technology, automotive, life sciences, and other industries secure and reliable AI services for exceptional structured data and customer experiences.
DataForce is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.
For more information about us, please visit our website: https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

At Vestas, our leitmotiv is Safety First! The Operational Support's goal is to give as many advice and alerts as needed in order to proceed to the different tasks in the best security conditions.
Our Operations Support Team has a great experience in the field, most of them come from our Service Technician teams, and their goal is to assist the teams finding and solving complex breakdowns.
This team also contributes to our Construction Teams and Client Support team with complex technical issues in order to support them in all their missions (technical arguments, problem solving, creation of quotes...)
Responsibilities
Contribute on the development of tools to Continuously monitor the configurations of Wind Sector Management, Noise Regulation, Bat protection and other similar services, that we call Customer "Optional's";
Create a database and tools (to be aligned and agreed with VPS) in order to map all the options requested by customers. Latest updates, history, customer approvals...
Request SCADA team or Operations to correct any deviation found, by using Sales Force or ticketing system;
Be accountable for correct implementation and performance of Optional's;
Understand customer needs, and ability to work with the commercial team on the current products and future needs.
Ability to explain the solutions internally and externally, and with good presentation and communication skills. Must increase internal knowledge of the company in these products.
Act as "anchor" for Optional's:
Be the main point of contact from operations.
Be the main point of contact towards group and VPS;
Scope and develop together with VPS and Eng. team automated monitoring of optional's by utilizing existing tools (like MUC, Power BI among others).
Qualifications
Master or bachelor degree in relevant area i.e. electrical or mechanical or marine engineering or data/statistics
Good technical background, with experience in data analytics, statistical analysis,
Experience in an industrial environment will be an advantage
Good English skills, both written and spoken
Full proficiency in the use of computers and the Pack Office
Competencies
Data analysis,
Problem solving
Communication
What We Offer
A team of skilled and committed colleagues who are all enthusiastic about wind energy.
You will have the opportunity of developing a career in a very exciting industry in a global company and have international exposure.
BEWARE – RECRUITMENT FRAUD
It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, www.vestas.com/en/careers/job-openings
About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry’s global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution – today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

description:
Imerys has launched a lithium mining project (the EMILI Project) at its Beauvoir site in Echassières (Allier, France). The EMILI Project schedule foresees production starting in 2028, with a production target of 34,000 tonnes of lithium hydroxide per year for at least 25 years.
The overall schedule states that by 2023 the preliminary mine design will be completed as well as the overall process validated and tested at the lab scale (several pilot plants are scheduled for Q2-Q3 2023). By 2024 the deposit will be characterized in detail and the construction of the industrial/demo pilot plant will commence. 2025 sees the commissioning of the industrial/demo pilot plant. The opening of the mine and commissioning of the commercial plant is scheduled by 2028.
The projected timetable will be reassessed at each stage of the project, in particular based on the results of the environmental impact assessments and stakeholder consultations.
Job Objective
As part of the Project Management office and reporting to the Industrial Project Manager:
Contribute to the design of the EMILI Process Plants, and ensure our consultants are delivering on time
Lead critical cross-functional Project activities, on an ad-hoc basis,
The job offers a high potential of career evolution within Imerys.
KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Missions of the Project Management Office:
Collaborate with other department leaders to define, prioritize, and develop projects.
Plan project management, including setting deadlines, prioritizing tasks, and assigning team members to various deliverables.
Analyze financial data, including project budgets, risks, and resources allocation.
In collaboration with the Financial Controller, provide financial reports and budget outlines to Executives
Oversee the development of the Project and ensure that team members are carrying out their tasks efficiently while upholding the company's standards.
Draft new and improve existing project management office policies and processes.
Continuously evaluate projects to ensure they are meeting company standards, adhering to budgets, and meeting deadlines.
Accurately document the project's creation, development, and execution as well as document the project's scope, budget, and justification.
Endorse the role of cross-functional Project Manager for untapped critical activities to the Project
Key tasks and responsibilities include but not limited to:
Support Project Manager to manage Engineering Consultants to deliver products on schedule
Participate in Engineering discussions (both internal and external)
Complete engineering reviews of submitted documentation
Coordinate reviews between various Imerys teams
Assist Project Manager to report progress, status and upcoming activities
Support Procurement Activities
Education and Experience requirements:
Qualifications:
Bs, BEng or B.Tech in Engineering or National Diploma.
Minimum 5 years of progressive experience in the execution of project management or engineering management for capital projects in an industrial environment. Experience in the chemicals or metals industries is preferred.
Knowledge, skills, Imerys Leadership Behaviors:
Highly motivated and results focused with the ability to act with a high sense of urgency
Ability to operate and execute effectively in a fast-paced environment with multiple priorities and challenging deadlines
Team-oriented, dynamic, proactive and adaptable
Strong attention to details and technicalities, rigor
Leadership skills and self-starter
Used to working in a multinational environment.
Skilled in communication, excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Languages: English (mandatory), French (desirable).
Well-developed computer skills and advanced knowledge of MS Office package word, databases, spreadsheets, scheduling.

Ensures that vendors’ documents are approved, commented, and returned to vendors on time.

description:
We are excited to announce a Project Engineer career opportunity at R8 Technologies. The position is open for applicants in France and is a fully remote role. We seek a driven specialist with exceptional communication skills and experience in Civil or Mechanical Engineering.
As a Project Engineer, you will be in charge of AI-powered software integration into real estate portfolios around the globe. The R8 Digital Operator Jenny is a sophisticated data-driven AI solution enabling real estate properties to rapidly decrease energy consumption and CO2 emissions. In addition, your contribution as the Project Engineer will have an immediate and long-term impact on climate change mitigation.
Position Requirements:
Mid- to Senior-level experience in HVAC, Energy Efficiency, or Building Automation;
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills;
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities;
Self-motivated and able to work independently under minimum supervision;
Fluent in English and French.
Position Benefits:
Competitive compensation
Fully remote role
Flexible hours to promote work-life balance
Sports compensation to support employee wellness
At R8 Technologies, we believe in optimizing buildings' operations through cutting-edge technology. Our team is passionate about applying AI-powered solutions to drive efficiency and sustainability in the construction, real estate, cleantech, energy, utilities, and technology industries. R8 Technologies HQ is located in Tallinn, Estonia - the most digitalized country in Europe. You will have the opportunity to work and grow with an exceptionally skilled team, take on challenging projects, advance the engineering field, and make a meaningful impact on climate change mitigation.
Sounds like your next challenge?
Become a part of the dynamic team that values innovation and employee well-being! Apply for the role by submitting your application through LinkedIn.
About R8 TECHNOLOGIES
R8tech is the leading AI technology company that manages over 3Mil m² of commercial real estate across Europe. Using R8 Digital Operator, a data-driven AI solution, R8tech helps enhance building operations of real estate properties, including office and public buildings, shopping malls, and hotels. R8 Digital Operator allows to reduce building operational expenses, increase in property value, upgrade building energy class, reduce CO2 emissions, and achieve sustainability compliance. R8tech client real estate portfolios include WeWork Office Buildings (Western Europe), Kauf Park Göttingen Shopping Mall (Germany), Porto Office Park (Portugal), Aalto University Campus (Finland), Kapitel Commercial Buildings (Eastern Europe), Ülemiste City Business District (Estonia) and many more.

description:
About Automotive Cells Company (ACC)
Join us and be a pioneer for a green transport revolution.
Automotive Cells Company (ACC) is one of Europe’s newest and most exciting high-tech companies. Backed by Saft-Total, Stellantis and Mercedes-Benz,
ACC is set to
power the future of the automotive industry
by innovating in battery technology.
We aim to produce sustainable, affordable, high-capacity, longer-life batteries as a
cleaner alternative to current energy sources
. We have created an R&D center and new state-of-the art facility in Nouvelle Aquitaine, France, and we are building gigafactories in Germany and Italy, in addition to the one already built in Hauts de France.
We need a range of
skilled and agile people
to bring our vision to life, especially in the areas of industrialization, mechanical design, testing/prototyping and any other function of a new-born company. If you’re looking to take your career further than you imagined, if you’re passionate about creating cleaner transport, we’d like to hear from you.
Our core Values are : Pioneering Spirit, Fast & Agile, Excellence, Greener & Cleaner !
We are also very proud of our 2022 CSR Report : https://www.acc-emotion.com/stories/accs-2022-corporate-sustainability-report
Accelerating sustainable mobility for all.
Job Description
We are seeking a talented and motivated Data Quality Engineer to join our team at ACC, a company aiming to become the leader in battery cell manufacturing in Europe for the automotive industry. Producing battery cells at high pace comes with millions of data points created each day and automatic ways to ensure the quality of this data is paramount to the success of ACCs data-driven endeavors.
As a Data Quality Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of our data. You will work closely with cross-functional teams in the business lines to enhance data quality according to the data quality dimensions, establish measurement criteria for data quality, and implement automated data quality checks in our data pipelines.
Responsibilities:
Enhance Data Quality:
Collaborate with business stakeholders and data engineers to identify key data quality dimensions, such as accuracy, consistency, completeness, timeliness, and reliability.
Develop a comprehensive understanding of our data sources, transformations, and data flows.
Establish Measurement Criteria:
Define clear and measurable data quality metrics for each dimension.
Implement data profiling and assessment techniques to evaluate data quality.
Monitor data quality over time and identify areas for improvement.
Acculturate People:
Educate and train team members and cross-functional collaborators on data quality best practices.
Foster a data quality culture within the organization.
Promote awareness of data quality issues and their impact on business decisions.
Implement Automated Data Quality Checks:
Collaborate with data engineers to embed data quality checks into our data pipelines.
Develop and maintain automated tests to validate data accuracy, consistency, validity, and completeness.
Continuously Improve Data Quality:
Participate in root cause analysis of data quality incidents.
Propose and implement process improvements to enhance data quality.
Stay informed about industry trends and emerging data quality tools and techniques.
Profile
Qualifications / Knowledge:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Quality Engineer or similar role.
Strong SQL skills for data profiling and validation.
PowerBI knowledge required for Data Quality monitoring dashboards.
Python and Linux skills favorable
Familiarity with data quality tools and frameworks, especially Great Expectations
Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Effective communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Meticulous and passionate about maintaining high-quality data.
If you are passionate about data quality and want to make a meaningful impact in one of Europe’s fastest growing manufacturing enterprises, we encourage you to apply!
Why join us?
Our Advantages and Perks:
new premises, parking spaces reserved for carpoolers, possibility of recharging your electric car on reserved spaces in our parking lot.
Other perks and advantages include : Company restaurant, meal and also vegetables/fruits baskets delivery service. Janitorial services, telecommuting, complementary retirement plan (subject to a salary threshold), additionnal & seniority leaves, well-being workshops, osteopathy sessions.
You will also benefit from access to our Sports & Culture association, conferences, and also sports, holidays and culture subsidy.

description:
About Density
Density's mission is to measure and improve our footprint on the world.
We help companies understand how their workplaces are used. At Density, we build one of the most advanced people sensing systems in the world. Density can tell you how many people are in any room in near real-time, with very high degrees of accuracy and without invading privacy.
We translate that data into actionable, opinionated insights that help companies increase the financial and experiential performance of any workplace. Today, we work with companies ranging from Fortune 1000 to high growth such as Uber, Pinterest, Shopify and Okta, occupying more than a billion square feet worldwide.
The result: lower emissions, less waste, better access, safer buildings and better designed cities. It is a long term pursuit and one we could use your help achieving. That's where you come in.
The Opportunity:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Pipeline Engineer to join our platform software team. The team's mission revolves around processing, storing, and presenting real-time analytics derived from thousands of sensors, offering insights into workplace utilization. As a Senior Data Pipeline Engineer at Density, you will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and optimizing our data pipelines. Your expertise will be crucial in transforming raw sensor data into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making across the workplace organization.
In this role you will:
Design, develop, and maintain scalable and robust data pipelines, ensuring efficient data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Optimize and fine-tune existing data pipelines for performance, reliability, and scalability.
Work with large data-streams to extract meaningful analytics and insights.
Implement best practices for data governance, data security, and data quality assurance.
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to provide them with clean, structured data for analysis and reporting.
Articulate your contributions with local French and US overseas platform team members
Find satisfaction in working remotely from your home.
The ideal candidate will have:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a proven track record of designing and implementing complex data solutions.
Proficiency in Python.
In-depth knowledge of SQL relational language
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex data issues.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Nice-To-Have:
Knowledge of Rust and Go is a plus.
Strong experience with ETL processes, data modeling, and data integration techniques.
Hands-on experience with big data technologies such as Spark, and Kafka.
Familiarity with AWS cloud platform and their data services.
Experience with data warehousing solutions (e.g Clickhouse, BigQuery) is a plus.
We offer:
A company full of fun, smart, talented and legitimately kind teammates. Our culture powers everything we do and we work hard to nurture it by bringing on the right humans.
A team hailing from innovators like Apple, LinkedIn, Stripe, Meraki, Flexport, WeWork, NASA & beyond.
$227M raised from investors including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund and Upfront Ventures.
The chance to change the built world as we know it.
You can read more about our values here.
Density provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
Job Compensation Range:
Salary Range: €60,000.00 - €90,000.00
Preferred Primary Location: Paris, France
An important note on salary:
The annual pay range for this position is based on the preferred primary location of the role which is listed above. If you are applying to this role at a location that is not the preferred primary location, please keep in mind the salary range will vary and may fall outside of what is listed. Only in truly rare and exceptional circumstances, where an external candidate has experience, credentials or expertise that far exceed those required or expected for the position, would the Density consider paying a salary or rate near the higher end of the range. Equity may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, depending on the position offered.

description:
Created in 2009, ESSP is a young and dynamic company, a pan European service provider, certified by EASA (the European Union Aviation Safety Agency) to deliver safety-critical services. Our mission is to operate and provide Communication, Navigation and Surveillance(CNS) services, among which, the main one is, the EGNOS service (the European Geostationary Navigation Overlay Service), on behalf of the EUSPA (the European Agency for Space).
ESSP Corporate Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_FKtcaN8YE
ESSP Website career: https://www.essp-sas.eu/human-resources/careers/
We are looking for an Application Project Engineer responsible for the life-cycle management of ESSP applications and tools. In this frame you will ensure that the business applications are consistent with the guidelines, operating methods and processes defined by the business teams.
You will contribute to Information System upgrades by ensuring that the applications are properly implemented, function properly and can be operated. You will aim at improving their performance by ensuring that the rules and procedures laid down are properly applied, particularly in the context of ISO27001 and ISO9001 certification.
For these activities, we are looking for someone with 3 to 5 years’ experience in IT, with a very good level of English (minimum B2).
Main Responsibilities/activities
Activities linked to the deployment of new versions:
Managing the portfolio of applications within and their lifecycle,
Management of Application TPM (Thir Party Maintenance) contracts,
Coordination of the network of players involved in running the applications (business teams, IT teams, suppliers),
The business interface for the applications,
Maintaining the overall operational quality and performance of the applications,
Monitoring bugs and changes to the applications,
Writting functional specifications to formalise requirements and detail the desired functionalities for the applications, taking into account technical, financial, quality and regulatory obligations,
Managing the application projects (scheduling, follow up stages of implementation, integration, acceptance, reporting, etc.),
Managing the reference documentation for the applications,
Supporting functional managers in using the application and identifying malfunctions;
Technology watch around software ecosystem;
Profile
Strong experience in Information Systems and digital technologies (SaaS, etc.)
Good knowledge of development methodologies and approaches (Agile/Scrum, DevOps, etc.)
Knowledge of data exchange protocols and standards (xml, json, soap, rest, etc.), as well as common data formats
Knowledge of programming languages and development frameworks (SQL, Java, PHP, Laravel, etc.)
Knowledge of ticketing tools (JIRA, etc.)
Good knowledge of project management methodologies
Understanding of data governance, quality and security issues (ISO 27001, GDPR, etc.)
Knowledge of IS management best practice (ITIL)
Autonomy, rigour and organisational skills
Ability to understand the challenges and functional requirements of the various business units
Team spirit and collaborative mindset
Excellent adaptability and interpersonal skills
Ability to analyse and summarise
Ability to make proposals
Excellent writing skills
Job Requirements
Engineering degree or equivalent
Available for occasional travel in Europe
Human Resources Information
1st interview is held by the direct manager of the position you applied for (technical interview)

description:
Qui est Saegus ?
Saegus est la
ConsulTech
qui accompagne ses clients (grands groupes du CAC 40 / SBF 120) dans leur transition vers l'entreprise intelligente et responsable de demain, le
Smart Shift
.
Le
Smart Shift
représente bien plus qu'une simple transition numérique. C'est une vision stratégique complète qui intègre les technologies émergentes, telles que l'intelligence artificielle et l'utilisation performante et raisonnée de la Data, à des changements culturels, organisationnels et de gouvernance.
Nous appliquons également l’approche Smart Shift pour offrir à nos consultants un environnement propice à leur développement professionnel et à leur épanouissement : The Best Place To Grow. Au-delà de pouvoir vivre l'expérience d'un
Smart Consultant
(par l'IA), en rejoignant notre équipe, vous bénéficierez d'une culture d'entreprise axée sur l'agilité, l'innovation et l'adaptabilité. Nous accompagnons nos Saegusien·ne·s à développer de nouvelles compétences, à explorer les nouvelles technologies et à cultiver un esprit entrepreneurial, le tout accompagné par une école du conseil (parcours de formation propre à Saegus), un catalogue de formations et de certifications et un coach interne.
Smart Shift. For Real.
Saegus est incarné par ses
quatre départements
:
Shift Acceleration, pour accélérer le passage d’une idée en un produit ou service au sein de grandes entreprises grâce à des outils et méthodologies agiles ;
Smart Data, pour rendre compréhensibles, exploitables et valorisables les données des entreprises ;
Smart Workplace, pour créer un environnement humain, physique et technologique optimal pour l’ensemble des collaborateur·rice·s ;
Smart Experience Factory, pour designer et développer des applications sur-mesure grâce à une méthode centrée utilisateurs.
Ainsi, nous recrutons un.e Consultant·e Cloud Data Engineer.
Concrètement, quelle sera la mission et les réalisations attendues ❓
En tant que
Consultant·e Data Engineer
, tu seras intégré·e à l’équipe Smart Data dont la mission est d’aider ses clients à tirer profit des technologies les plus innovantes pour valoriser leurs données. De l’acquisition à la restitution, tu interviens sur chaque étape du processus d’aide à la décision.
Tu participeras aux missions de conseil et d’expertise afin de contribuer à l’atteinte des objectifs majeurs de nos clients et contribueras à la
réalisation de projets tels que
:
⚡️ Le design d’une plateforme Azure Cloud et la mise en place de pipeline d’ingestion et exposition de données pour la mise à disposition de données métiers, rafraîchies toutes les 30mn
⚡️ La mise en place des bonnes pratiques et l’initialisation du Datalab pour un grand groupe d’assurance, et l’accompagnement à l’industrialisation des algorithmes pour les usages métiers
⚡️ L’ensemble des traitements d’ingestion et préparation des datasets afin d’alimenter des Dashboard de monitoring de l’activité digitale Worldwide d’un grand groupe cosmétique afin de mesurer l’empreinte des marques sur les médias et réseaux sociaux
⚡️ L’accompagnement à la création et l’activité d’une Data Factory pour traiter l’ensemble des données d’un grand groupe de distribution et mettre à disposition des données qualifiées pour les différents use cases métiers
Nous recherchons un.e passionné.e possédant une envie de de fédérer et faire monter en valeur les consultants autour des thématiques Data Engineering recouvrant la mise en place de Plateforme de données, des bonnes pratiques de développements et des process DataOps, l’industrialisation de pipeline de traitements de données pouvant aller jusqu’à la Data Visualisation.
➜ Dans quel environnement ?
En fonction de tes missions et réalisations projet, tu seras amené·e à intégrer des équipes composées de Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Architects, organisées en mode agile. Tes activités s’appuieront sur les méthodes et savoir-faire de Saegus et sur son catalogue d’outils et technologies sur lesquels tu as une maîtrise sur plusieurs d’entre eux :
✅ Bonnes connaissances sur les architectures data et cloud (connaissance d’un environnement Cloud) :
Azure (Data Factory, Synapse, ADLS, Databricks)
Google GCP (BigQuery, Composer, Data Studio)
✅ SQL, Python
✅ Spark, PySpark
✅ Airflow, Kafka, Jenkins
✅ Solides connaissances des processus collaboratifs et outils de développement (DevOps, Git, CI/CD…)
Les connaissances suivantes seraient un plus ⤵️
OpenShift, Docker, Kubernetes
Data visualisation
Bases NoSQL
Certification Data Engineer (Azure Data Engineer, Google Professional Data Engineer ou Snowflake SnowPro)
Ce que nous t’apportons
💫
FORMATIONS ET DÉVELOPPEMENT DE CARRIÈRE
Une journée de formation incluse dans ton parcours d’onboarding lors de ton premier mois d’arrivée pour partager sur les fondamentaux et répondre à tes questions
Accès à un coach interne et consultant comme toi pour t’accompagner dans ton quotidien (questions en particulier, aide, montée en compétences)
Un plan de formations et de certifications ambitieux (minimum 1 certification offerte par an)
⭐️
AVANTAGES
Remboursement de tes frais de transports (remboursement à 100% de ton pass navigo ou forfait mobilité durable jusqu’à 700€ par an pour l’utilisation et l’aide à l’achat de matériel de mobilité douce)
Titres restaurant à hauteur de 216€/mois pris en charge à 60% par Saegus (Carte Swile)
Prime vacances (versée en juin)
Prime téléphone 25€/mois
Prime d’intéressement aux résultats de l’entreprise
Prise en charge par Saegus de la mutuelle à la hauteur de 75%
👋
COHÉSION ET CONVIVIALITÉ
Organisation de deux activités par mois (fun, solidaire ou excellence) par notre Team Anim
Un séminaire annuel pour favoriser la cohésion entre Saegusiens
Accès aux locaux de Saegus, très accueillants dans le centre de Paris notamment lors de nos SaegUp mensuel
Profil recherché
🎯
Idéalement, en termes de compétences, nous recherchons
:
Un profil de formation supérieure (Bac + 5 minimum), ingénieur ou équivalent, avec une expérience d’au moins 3 ou 4 ans minimum dans le domaine du Big Data.
Tu as déjà mené avec succès plusieurs projets Big Data avec des références significatives dans la mise en place de flux de données et de traitement de l’information.
Tu interviens en autonomie sur tes projets et as une première expérience d’encadrement technique.
Tu es motivé.e pour intégrer une structure alliant l’exigence d’un cabinet de conseil et le dynamisme et l’agilité d’une start-up.
Tu es un·e très bon·ne communiquant·e et as un fort esprit d’initiative, un goût prononcé pour les nouvelles technologies et un bon esprit de synthèse.
Ton sens du service et ton écoute client te permettront de t’inscrire parfaitement dans la culture de notre cabinet de conseil.
La
maîtrise de l’anglais et du français
à l’écrit et à l’oral est indispensable.

This role involves steering the design from its conceptual stage (pre-A) through to the whole life of the project, ensuring a thorough validation and review of the design’s performance and manufacturability at each stage with the relevant stakeholders.
The engineer will possess the ability to identify and mitigate potential risks associated with the design and manufacturing process during each phase of scale-up. As the Industrialization Leader, the engineer will oversee one cell project, ensuring its successful execution and implementation. This role requires a deep understanding of cell formation processes, a keen eye for detail, and strong communication skills in a multicultural environment.
In a nutshell :
The Formation Industrialization Engineer will be entrusted with the ownership of the cell formation and its integration within product/process teams. This role involves steering the design from its conceptual stage (pre-A) through to the whole life of the project, ensuring a thorough validation and review of the design’s performance and manufacturability at each stage with the relevant stakeholders

description:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
About the Company
This company engages in the exploration, production, transportation, and sale of crude oil and natural gas. It operates through the following segments: Upstream, Downstream, and Corporate. The Upstream segment includes crude oil, natural gas and natural gas liquids exploration, field development, and production. The Downstream segment focuses on refining, logistics, power generation, and the marketing of crude oil, petroleum and petrochemical products, and related services to international and domestic customers. The Corporate segment offers supporting services including human resources, finance, and information technology. The company was founded on May 29, 1933 and is headquartered in Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Job Summary
We are seeking an experienced Engineer who is specialized in Instrumentation & Process Control to join our Project Management team (PMT). This Company Project Management Teams are responsible and accountable for the delivery of best in class capital projects. PMT is directly involved in executing and managing assigned projects safely, on schedule, within budget and to the highest standards of integrity and compliance. This will involve engineering design, procurement and construction of various sizes ($), types and complexity of small, medium to multi-billion-dollar mega projects. Project Management Team manages and executes projects usually from multiple site offices or engineering contractor design offices, geographically scattered throughout the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. The primary role is to ensure that engineering design, procurement, construction and project completion is done in compliance with the project objective and contractual requirements i.e. project schedule, cost, HSE, company standards and procedures. The role also involves review, study, design, and construction of grass root and brown field refining and petrochemical facilities.
Responsibilities:
Execute capital projects according to the scope, schedule, and budget.
Perform complex technical and administrative tasks relative to the design and coordination of specialized controls and instrumentation systems.
Provide technical input and review of the design, construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, and startup of facilities.
Address technical issues arising in all phases of the project development related to Instrumentation & Process Control parts of the facilities.
Responsible for project development: engineering studies, technical bid reviews, preliminary engineering, detail designs, materials procurement, construction, pre-commissioning, handover, commissioning, and startup.
Review and provide input to the Functional Specification for PCS and Field Instrumentation that fully comply with This Company standards and specifications.
Manage General Engineering Services (GES) design contractor activities during the development of Pre-FEED & FEED, including definition of project work scope and schedule requirements.
Development of a detailed estimate leading to funding appropriation and approval.
Be familiar with international procedures of Projects Phases, Engineering Phases, Bidding procedures, Procurement Processes, Construction Requirements, and up-to-date Best Practices.
Full understanding of contract documents (inclusive of appendices, drawings, and specifications), project execution plan, interface management, change management, construction sequencing, standards specifications, and project schedule to support project manager and/or company representative in timely completion of projects.
Review and resolve day-to-day contractors' activities related to assigned project (process) work during construction and ensure HSE compliance.
Participate in developing Instrumentation & Process Control deliverables and others such as BDs, SLDs, P&IDs, ILDs, ISDs, ISS, C&E diagrams, HAZID, HAZOP, SIL, simulations, control narrative, energy optimization, startup plans, etc.
Provide design input in the identification, sizing, selection, and procurement of field instrumentation including control valves.
Attend Factory Acceptance Test (FAT) of the Process Control System and resolve any technical issue prior to shipment to the site.
Conduct Site Acceptance Test (SAT) and Integration Site Acceptance Test (ISAT) for all Process Control System and resolve any technical issues that arise.
Perform change order scope definition, cost estimation, and assist the Project Manager or Company representative in the change management process.
Review weekly and monthly reports on the status and progress of the contracts, including project costs and schedule. Attend project meetings e.g. progress, stakeholders, design review, plot plan, value improvement.
Review the project schedule, coordinate and monitor the assigned project progress and challenge below-par performance of the contractor.
Review, coordinate, and monitor invoices (claimed vs actual physical progress checks) and contractor's submittals.
Perform Project Reporting and implementation of company initiatives during project execution.
Review design/study Instrumentation & Process Control modifications to the facilities.
Provide routine Instrumentation & Process Control (design and construction) support to facilities.
Develop and/or review testing and commissioning procedures for Instrumentation & Process Control equipment especially in the facilities.
Be familiar with leading equipment manufacturers/vendors, international standards, and value improvement practices.
Develop and deliver training material to promote environmental awareness among refinery personnel.
Requirements:
This role required candidate to permanently relocate at Dhahran, Saudi Arabia.
Hold a Bachelor's Degree in Electrical/Electronics/Instrumentation Engineering from a recognized and approved program.
Have a minimum of Fifteen (15) years of experience in the refining and petrochemical industries, with a specialty in Instrumentation & Process Control.
Have at least five (5) years of field experience in construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, startup, and operation.
Possess Engineering Design & Construction phase experience with a thorough knowledge of engineering practices and economic principles in the applicable International Codes, Standards, and Specifications.
Have expertise in specific control & instrumentation disciplines such as Advanced process control (APC), Distributed control systems (DCS), Programmable logic controllers (PLC), Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA), Emergency shutdown system (ESD), and more.
Demonstrate a dynamic attitude towards project improvements and savings.
PMP Certification is desirable but not mandatory.
Be flexible to work in multinational teams and mobilize to different locations, including remote areas as needed.

description:
Descriptif de l'entité et de l'activité
Air Liquide Global E&C Solutions est un partenaire technologique de choix pour la conception, l'ingénierie et la construction d'unités de production de pointe dans le monde entier. Grâce à nos équipes et à leur capacité d'innovation constante, nous permettons à nos clients d'optimiser l'utilisation des ressources naturelles pour fournir une énergie propre et durable. Nos technologies exclusives et particulièrement innovantes nous permettent de contribuer à la transformation du secteur de l'énergie, à la préservation et à la protection de l'atmosphère de notre planète.
Forts de plusieurs dizaines d'années d'expertise opérationnelle au sein du leader mondial des gaz, technologies et services pour l'industrie et la santé, nous concevons pour nos clients des solutions originales, sûres, fiables et concurrentielles et proposons dans le monde entier les meilleures unités de production dans un marché en constante évolution.
Missions & Responsabilités
La mission principale de l'ingénieur procédés est de définir la solution process la plus adaptée pour répondre aux besoins du client. Cela inclut la compréhension des besoins des clients, la proposition et la simulation de différentes solutions techniques, l'analyse critique de solutions alternatives, la taille de l'équipement pour l'estimation, la validation des devis des fournisseurs et la contribution à la documentation technique des produits.
En particulier, vous travaillerez sur le développement de produits CO2 pour le captage du carbone pour l'industrie, contribuerez à des propositions, des études de faisabilité et FEEDs (Front-End Engineering Design). Vous serez également impliqué dans l'exécution pour assurer la continuité et la capitalisation.
Plus spécifiquement, vos missions seront les suivantes :
Développer des CO2 Process Design Packages pour améliorer l'efficacité, la fiabilité, la sécurité de la gamme de produits CO2.
Challenger toutes les fonctions du produit et proposer des méthodes de réduction des coûts en fonction des besoins du marché.
Examiner la documentation (P&ID, Process Data Sheet, Equipment list...) des projets précédents et rechallenger les choix du point de vue du process, le cas échéant.
Livrer et tenir à jour des PFD/PID génériques, des documents de spécification, des process design packages et des systèmes de contrôle.
Participer (être lead le cas échéant) aux échanges techniques avec les clients ou les fournisseurs.
Collaborer à l'exécution du projet.
Participer à la mise en service et au démarrage des nouvelles usines CO2.
Documenter et communiquer les connaissances du procédé CO2 dans l'ensemble de l'organisation.
Fournir une expertise en génie des procédés pour l'ensemble des produits de la gamme de produits CO2.
Collaborer à la création de matériel de marketing et/ou de formation.
Proposer des idées innovantes du marché (fournisseur, retour client) et suivre leur mise en œuvre le cas échéant, en vue d'améliorer la compétitivité des produits.
Contribuer à l'élargissement de notre portefeuille de propriété intellectuelle CO2.
Profil & Compétences
De formation Ingénieur génie chimique / des procédés, vous disposez d'
une première expérience (hors stage et alternance) en tant qu'ingénieur procédés.
Vous avez le goût pour la technique et la capacité à comprendre des types de procédés différents ou innovants en faisant appel à des connaissances techniques étendues.
Orienté solution, vous avez une aptitude à remettre en question le statu quo, toujours à la recherche de moyens innovants pour améliorer la compétitivité des produits.
Anglais courant indispensable.

description:
Ellona
, est une startup innovante créée en 2016 qui développe des solutions d’intelligence situationnelle qui permet d’optimiser les processus industriels.
La société est spécialisée dans la mesure en temps réel des émissions environnementales (gaz et odeurs, bruits et sons, particule et allergènes, lumière ..) en atmosphère extérieur et intérieur, grâce à des objets connectés incluant des microcapteurs et des algorithmes d’IA de traitement de données innovants. Les succès commerciaux, les awards et les retombées presse confirment l’audience mondiale de cette startup et l’intérêt des personnes pour ces sujets ainsi que des industrielles de toutes tailles.
Les solutions d’Ellona visent à réduire l’empreinte énergétique et carbone des procédés tout en améliorant les conditions d’un environnement sain et durables pour les citoyens, les collaborateurs et les clients. Les nuisances environnementales ont des répercussions quantifiables sur le monde du travail et la productivité, sur la santé des personnes et leur consommation de services ainsi que sur la qualité de vie dans les villes. Les solutions d’Ellona intègrent, à des niveaux divers, des capteurs de sons, de gaz et de vibrations qui couplés à des bases de données vont fournir un suivi en temps réel des émissions. L’objectif est de permettre la mise en place des actions de remédiation entraînant une amélioration des conditions de travail, des process, et une augmentation de la rentabilité.
Avec presque 4000 systèmes déployés en direct ou par la vingtaine de distributeurs au niveau mondial Ellona couvre principalement les activités suivantes : Les sites industriels, ceux de la construction, les activités portuaires et aéroportuaires.
Ses clients permettent à Ellona de se développer à l’international : Bouygues, Elior, HITACHI, ADP, etc
Le poste:
L'Ingénieur Data Qualité de l'Air est un spécialiste clé au sein de l'équipe Customer Success d'Ellona (3 personnes, ce poste inclus), jouant un rôle essentiel dans l'analyse et l'interprétation des données environnementales générées par les produits de la société. Ce poste demande une compréhension approfondie des données relatives à la qualité de l'air et une capacité à transmettre cette expertise aux clients d'Ellona.
Ce recrutement qui viendra renforcer l’équipe a pour objectif :
De permettre d’absorber une croissance du nombre d’installations,
De contribuer à l’augmentation de la qualité et de la réactivité du support client,
De contribuer à l’amélioration du renouvellement des licences des clients existants.
Les missions:
Rattachée à l’équipe Customer Success la personne recrutée interviendra au travers des missions suivantes :2. Accompagnement et Conseil Client :3. Contribution à l'Amélioration des Produits :4. Formation et Support Technique :
Analyse et Interprétation des Données :
Responsable de l'analyse des données de qualité de l'air collectées par les produits Ellona.
Interprétation des données pour fournir des informations pertinentes et utiles aux clients.
Accompagner les clients dans la compréhension des données de qualité de l'air et leur application pratique.
Offrir des conseils experts sur l'optimisation de l'utilisation des produits Ellona.
Collaborer avec les équipes de R&D pour intégrer les retours clients dans l'amélioration des produits.
Contribuer à l'évolution des fonctionnalités des produits en fonction des besoins spécifiques des clients.
Assurer la formation des clients et des partenaires sur les aspects techniques et analytiques des produits Ellona.
Fournir un soutien technique pour les questions liées à la qualité de l'air et l'analyse des données.
ProfilIssu au minimum d’un cursus supérieur Ingénieur (BAC+5) ou équivalent dans le domaine de l’électronique, de l’instrumentation analytique, ou de l’environnement, vous justifiez d'une expérience de 2 ans minimum en support terrain sur des systèmes de mesures (métrologie, capteurs, spectroscopie, chromatographie, en analyses sensorielles, …)
Des connaissances dans le domaine de la qualité de l’air (pollution atmosphérique, indices, réglementation) seront appréciées.
Des déplacements occasionnels sont à prévoir.
La maîtrise de l’anglais est nécessaire.

description:
At Lilly, we unite caring with discovery to make life better for people around the world. We are a global healthcare leader headquartered in Indianapolis, Indiana. Our employees around the world work to discover and bring life-changing medicines to those who need them, improve the understanding and management of disease, and give back to our communities through philanthropy and volunteerism. We give our best effort to our work, and we put people first. We’re looking for people who are determined to make life better for people around the world.
Organization Overview
Indianapolis Device Manufacturing (IDM) - Asset Deliver Process Engineering provide the technical leadership in developing, designing, constructing, and delivering/upgrading automated device assembly and packaging lines for IDM globally to both Lilly sites and Contract Manufacturers (CMO).
Responsibilities
IDM Asset Delivery Process engineers oversee the technical aspects of developing, designing, constructing, and delivering automated device assembly and packaging lines for IDM globally to both Lilly sites and Contract Manufacturers in support of new product launches, capacity expansions, and line extensions. In doing this, they function as the Technical Lead for the project. In addition, when primary support teams for the global installed base (CMO and Lilly sites) require assistance, these engineers provide assistance or leadership in returning lines to service or optimizing lines. These engineers also develop and implement best practices for design and startup of device assembly lines and deploy systems to capture and utilize process data.
Lead the technical assessment of OEM technical proposals and make recommendations as to OEM suitability
Lead the generation rationalization of user requirements for each project
Lead the definition and mitigation of technical and patient risks, including use of FMEA
Assure each design includes maximum appropriate re-use of technology from prior projects
Oversee the OEM's design process, assuring questions are resolved and barriers to progress are removed

description:
Company Description
FGM International is a leading provider of design, development, and operational management services for complex farming projects. With over 30 years of successful worldwide experience in challenging farming projects implemented over Africa, Asia, and Eastern Europe, providing institutions and investors with pragmatic and sustainable solutions to develop crop production, the company supports its clients by confirming their production site selection, building complete agro-economic feasibility studies, starting the crop production operation, and delivering on-demand technical advice at all stage of the project’s life. The company team is a mix of senior expertise and younger profile with a shared sense of agriculture, adventure, and excellence, being able to be proficient on site, for assessment and production, and at the headquarters to prepare top-notch reports. Currently in a growing perspective, with the opening of new markets in Asia, we are looking to integrate a new teammate.
Role Description
This is a full-time position for a Project Engineer in Agriculture at FGM International in Saintes (France). The Project Engineer will participate in the development of the company in its different markets. He/she will oversee the identification of agricultural sites and will participate in pre-feasibility and feasibility studies as well as their economic analysis. The engineer may be mobilized for technical assistance "in the field" or training actions.
He/she will mainly carry out three types of activities:
In the field, in tandem with a senior staff: evaluation of agricultural sites and projects, technical assistance and transfer of skills according to current contracts (approx. 10 missions abroad per year),
At the company's headquarters: data mining, analysis of data collected on site, development of cropping models and preparation and technical reporting,
Occasional involvement in prospecting or training missions.
Qualification
Ideally from a higher education (Msc. or Engineering degree) in Agronomy or Agriculture,
Other higher education diploma acceptable with recognized on-field agricultural experience.
Know-how
1 year of professional experience is mandatory (internship excluded),
Fluency in English,
French or other languages will be appreciated,
Crop production (grain, forage, oilseeds, plain-field vegetable and/or other),
Soil conservation and sustainable agricultural practices.
Soft skills
Ability to understand and adapt to challenging environments,
Pragmatic and solution-oriented,
Rigorous.
Conditions
Salary: 30-50 k€ gross per year depending on the profile and experience.
Perks: French employment contract, health insurance, meal vouchers, partial remote work.

description:
Company Overview:
MACOM designs and manufactures semiconductor products for Data Center, Telecommunication and Industrial and Defense applications. Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM has design centers and sales offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia. MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard.
MACOM has more than 65 years of application expertise with multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. Click here to view our facilities. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business.
MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.
MACOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce. MACOM will not discriminate against any worker or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military obligations, or membership in any other category protected under applicable law.
Job Description:
The Product Engineer is responsible for MACOM products from product development kick-off until end of life. The Product Engineer will be responsible for defining production test plans and supporting launching new products into high volume production. This position is part of the product engineering group field application and cooperates with cross-functional teams of Design, Test, Reliability to drive projects to completion.
Primary Job Functions:
New Product Introduction – responsible for product life cycle management.
Understand contributors to the highest level in product quality, cost, and drive cost reductions.
Manage test house qualifications and yield improvements.
Characterization, ATE and probe data analysis.
Developing production and characterization test specifications.
Creating and managing product documentation.
Providing product development support which involves interfacing with Design, Test, Application, Quality Engineering.
Identify new design and product upselling opportunities.
Align customer design requirements with MACOM products and technology
Provide guidance and input for customer proposals.
Develop the product validation environment including hardware and software.
Validate the product in its end application and writing validation reports.
Creation of collaterals such as application notes, product presentations, publications, etc.
Provide training to the sales and marketing organization.
Requires excellent communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work closely and coordinate activities with other functional groups.
Must have excellent analytical and technical skills to find and resolve any product, process, test, and yield issues.
Must be able to work well under pressure, changing priorities, and constant interruptions.
Must be able to multi-task, coordinate meetings, prepare and give technical presentations.
Train customers and distributor FAEs on the benefits and features of MACOM products.
Be an advocate for MACOM products and technology
Required Skills & Experience:
Master’s Degree or PHD in Electronic Engineering.
Solid working knowledge Product Life Cycle.
Considerable experience in techniques for problem isolation/solving, test issue resolution, and yield enhancement.
Knowledge in the field of semiconductors and different design (power amplifier PA, low noise amplifier LNA, Core Chip CC, Mixer, Trans-Impedance Amplifier TIA…)
Knowledge of bench equipment like network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, RF sources, power meters
Statistical methods and tools
Demonstrable project management skills
Desire to learn and develop.
Good communications skills
Excellent problem solving and debug skills
Ability to work in a fast paced, project-oriented team environment.
Team player.
Self-motivated with ability to multi-task and work independently
Desirable Skills
Lab Equipment knowledge related to VNA, Spectrum Analyzer, Digital and Real-Time Oscilloscope.
Understand in troubleshooting HW.
Familiarity with the following software: Python, C, C++, Jupyter,ADS

description:
TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.
Job Purpose
The Nîmes site is a centre of excellence for the group. Our engineers work on a variety of subjects, including subsea lines (dynamic and static) and renewable energies, with know-how including hydrodynamics, fluid dynamics, mechanics and coding. In a small sized company atmosphere, our experts provide technical support to the different global sites for their complex projects. They also carry out R&D for the group, developing knowledge, design processes and internal tools.
We are looking for a "Subsea Engineer" to carry out the dimensioning and dynamic analysis of subsea riser & pipeline systems. You preferably have a mechanical and/or hydrodynamic engineering background. Technical knowledge of commercial Finite Element Analysis software (e.g. Abaqus) is required. Knowledge of dynamic analysis tools is a plus (e.g. Orcaflex, Deeplines, etc.). You have a solid basis in coding to create routines to implement specific internal methods (e.g. in Python).
Job Description
The responsibilities of the position include the following:
Review and analyse project specifications, client design proposals and other data to assess the feasibility, suitability and constraints of project designs or applications;
Ensure mastery and development of discipline design tools, based on state-of-the-art engineering methodology and relevant codes and standards;
Perform the necessary studies to develop and design equipment / procedures according to the project objectives, with due regard to the applicable codes and standards;
Ensure the preparation of project deliverables; create and present reports/deliverables detailing results, product features and conclusions drawn from engineering studies.
Report to his/her manager on the progress and on the expected completion of the deliverables.
As a Subsea Engineer, you will report to the Lead Engineer in charge of the project package in Nîmes and to the General Manager of the company. You will work mainly in our Nîmes office, with occasional travel abroad for project meetings and/or seminars. Teleworking is possible according to the agreement in force in the company, with compulsory presence in the offices at least three days a week.
You Are Meant For This Job If
You are preferably a hydrodynamic and/or mechanical engineer.
You enjoy working in a team, sharing your knowledge, developing your colleagues and learning from them. You are autonomous in managing your work while communicating naturally with your team and managers.
You are solution-oriented, your goal will be to help us solve complex problems. You are open-minded, speak professional English and enjoy working in a multicultural environment.
Skills
Additional Skills
Leadership Competencies
Being a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment. TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities to all ages, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender expressions, disabilities, or all other pluralities. We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.
TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.

description:
About the job
We are a global offshore geoscience and geotechnical engineering consultancy specialising in marine geophysics and geotechnics, ground modelling, foundation engineering, cables/pipelines, trenching and numerical analyses. We work primarily in the offshore renewable energy and sporadically in the oil and gas industry for clients who design, install, and operate offshore, nearshore, and onshore facilities.
Our team has a strong pipeline of projects and anticipate accelerating growth with the development of wind farms in the North Sea, the Baltic Sea, Mediterranean, United States and on the Asian continent.
We are looking for
experienced geotechnical engineers to join our team in Nanterre (Paris area, France) in senior level roles.
The successful applicant will work alongside existing offshore geoscience and engineering staff to deliver consultancy services for our offshore energy projects.
Those services will include ground characterisation projects, submarine cable engineering, ground modelling, investigation design and supervision, foundation design and installation, supervision, and other various consultancy activities. You will be working either independently or supervised by a more senior engineer, as part of a team or managing teams of geotechnical engineers, engineering geologists, geophysicists, and GIS specialists. You will be given early exposure to client contacts and the freedom to ‘think outside the box’ and, where required, push the boundaries of knowledge in the industry.
You will work with dynamic and entrepreneurial colleagues spread across a range of disciplines.
You will be given the opportunity to contribute to research and development initiatives, participating in international conferences and prepare technical papers.
Who are we looking for?
The ideal candidate will have a master degree in civil engineering and shall demonstrate 5 to 10 years post study, relevant industry experience in ground modelling, foundation engineering and in the application of geotechnical design methods or in support of large infrastructure projects. A PhD degree in geotechnical engineering would be admirable.
Direct experience in geotechnical design of foundations and cables, ground modelling, site investigation, in offshore and in the offshore wind industry is beneficial, although not essential in all cases. Installation, operations and maintenance experience, specially for offshore structures will also be a plus.
The ideal candidate will have a true passion for engineering, geotechnics, structures, and a hunger for knowledge and sharing knowledge and experience with others within the team.
The successful candidate will:
have a record of producing high-quality outputs and work practices, we will then help you develop new ways of reporting and analysing data using methods which are at the forefront of our industry
demonstrate strategic decision-making skills
demonstrate a willingness to continue learning and developing new technical knowledge and business acumen
have a good level of technical experience and strong ability in their area of expertise
show effective management of his/her own work in terms of quality, timescales, utilisation and invoicing
hold good communication skills, initiative and team work
communicate effectively and represent Cathie at client meetings, workshops, presentations and publications
lead and/or contribute to project management activities, including budgets, resources, client liaison, delivery, and QA
always be respectful of fellow colleagues and managers, with a proactive attitude, and strong work ethic
Required technical knowledge:
solid knowledge of soil and rock mechanics and foundation engineering
solid knowledge of ground investigation methodology and interpretation
understanding of structural engineering
demonstrable design experience and working knowledge of applicable regulations, codes of practice and standards in geotechnical and foundation engineering
understanding of advanced laboratory tests (e.g. Cyclic TX/Cyclic DSS, ring shear, resonant column tests)
experience in writing Ground Investigation Reports (GIR) and Geotechnical Design Reports (GDR)
experience in ground investigation campaigns (onshore or offshore) and data interpretation, including ground modelling
experience in the use of industry-standard numerical modelling software such as FLAC, or PLAXIS for modelling soil-structure interaction problems
Additional required knowledge:
experience in management of technical deliverables
ability to write technical/calculation reports in a concise, precise and logical format
strong attention to detail
good interdisciplinary communication skills
ability to think independently and solve problems, applying innovative solutions where required
ability to manage workload and prioritise tasks
passion for geological, geotechnical / civil engineering and the renewable energy sector
Where:
your office will be in Nanterre, in the Paris area; this is a hybrid role, you will be required to be physically in the office, with part of the time remotely
Nice to haves:
offshore client representative experience or site investigation experience if you come from a contractor’s background, current offshore working certificates
expert user of Plaxis, FLAC3D, Abaqus, PFEM, UDEC
knowledge of AGS formats and geotechnical reporting software
experience using Python, Tableau, Power BI
experience in the energy and infrastructure sectors
What we offer:
the opportunity to work for a leading engineering consultancy with a highly-regarded reputation in offshore engineering
a modern and friendly office environment
flexible working arrangements
opportunities for internally provided and external training
mentorship by reputable lead engineers
flexible working hours and locations (mixed work patterns and remote working)
Benefits
competitive salary
company pension scheme
healthcare cover for employee and family through APRIL health (“Assurance Mutuelle")
annual discretionary bonus
contribution to travel daily to main office from home in Paris area (based on NAVIGO)

description:
Contexte
Capgemini Engineering est la marque du groupe Capgemini réunissant les services d’ingénierie et de R&D de Capgemini Engineering, leader mondial du secteur dont Capgemini a finalisé l’acquisition en 2020, et l’expertise de Capgemini dans le domaine du
digital manufacturing
. Grâce à une connaissance sectorielle approfondie et à la maîtrise des technologies digitales et logicielles de pointe, Capgemini Engineering accompagne la convergence des mondes physique et numérique. Conjuguée avec l’ensemble des capacités du Groupe, elle aide les entreprises à accélérer leur transformation vers l’
Intelligent Industry
. Capgemini Engineering compte plus de 52 000 ingénieurs et scientifiques dans plus de 30 pays, dans des secteurs tels que l’aéronautique, l’automobile, le ferroviaire, les communications, l’énergie, les sciences de la vie, les semi-conducteurs, les logiciels et l’Internet, l’aérospatial et la défense, et les biens de consommation.
Capgemini Engineering fait partie du groupe Capgemini, un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant 270 000 personnes dans près de 50 pays. Partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie, le Groupe est guidé au quotidien par sa raison d’être : libérer les énergies humaines par la technologie pour un avenir inclusif et durable. Fort de plus de 50 ans d’expérience et d’une grande expertise des différents secteurs d’activité, Capgemini est reconnu par ses clients pour répondre à l’ensemble de leurs besoins, de la stratégie et du design jusqu’au management des opérations, en tirant parti des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution du cloud, de la data, de l’Intelligence Artificielle, de la connectivité, des logiciels, de l’ingénierie digitale et des plateformes. Le Groupe a réalisé un chiffre d’affaires de 16 milliards d’euros en 2020
Vos missions
Assurer la bonne santé du work package (court/moyen/long terme).
Assurer la conformité de maturité de la pièce.
Traiter les non-conformités : QSR, SARI, Lob, escalation.
Vérifier les livrables du fournisseur.
Sécuriser les livraisons.
Surveiller les procédés spéciaux.
Déploiement des standards (APQP, PPAP, Packaging, CCP, control plan).
Evaluer la charge capacitaire des fournisseurs.
Supporter l'auditeur, lors des audits avec les fournisseurs et gérer le plan d'action.
Participer aux Business Review: Être dans une démarche d'amélioration continue (développer des projets stratégiques avec les fournisseurs).
Réaliser des déplacements chez les fournisseurs.
S'assurer que le fournisseur soit dans une démarche de Risk Management
Compétences clés
De formation supérieure en méthode industrielle/amélioration continue/qualité.
Vous devez impérativement avoir de l'expérience dans le domaine industriel (Aéronautique, Automobile...).
La pratique de l'Anglais
La connaissance d'outils qualité (8D/9S, TPS, PPAP/ APQP/ flow chart) sont indispensables pour mener à bien vos projets.
Vous maitrisez l'ERP SAP.

description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une jeune entreprise française (et singapourienne) à taille humaine et en forte croissance, tournée vers l’innovation et l’international ? 🚀
Vous êtes soucieux(se) des défis énergétiques et environnementaux de notre époque, et vous voulez contribuer concrètement à la sobriété énergétique et à la réduction des émissions de CO2 ? 🌱
Alors rejoignez-nous ! 🌟
Implantée en France (Rennes et Lyon), en Espagne et à Singapour, et forte d’une expertise transdisciplinaire (IT, data-science, génie thermique), BeeBryte propose des services innovants de contrôle prédictif optimal distant 24/7 et de support aux opération & maintenance pour aider nos clients industriels et tertiaires à augmenter l’efficacité énergétique et la performance de leurs systèmes de CVC-R (chauffage, ventilation, climatisation, réfrigération).
Pour cela nous mettons en œuvre une surcouche intelligente, portée par notre plateforme Industrial-IoT, qui exploite les informations profondes des systèmes existants et de leur contexte pour maximiser en permanence leur performance énergétique.
En anticipant besoins et facteurs d’influence, nous permettons à nos clients de réduire efficacement leur empreinte carbone, de circonscrire leurs risques, et de réaliser jusqu’à 40% d’économies sur leurs factures énergétiques.
En tant que
HVAC Optimization Engineer
, vous rendez compte directement au Responsable du service Optimisation au sein du Département Exécution.
Doté de connaissances en Data-Science et ingénierie thermique, d’une compréhension approfondie des techniques d'optimisation, et d’une appétence pour l’innovation, vous êtes responsable de concevoir et mettre en place des algorithmes d’optimisation de la consommation énergétique des bâtiments dans le respect des contraintes techniques du système.
Missions et responsabilités de la fonction
Identifier sur chaque site les équipements qui peuvent être contrôlés, comprendre leur fonctionnement et leurs contraintes opérationnelles (analyse documentaire et visite de site),
Identifier les meilleures pistes d’optimisations à déployer,
En lien avec le service Automatisme, définir les capteurs et actionneurs nécessaires au déploiement de ces optimisations et mener les mises en services sur les sites clients,
Transmettre pour chaque site son expertise du système CVC-R et ses connaissances des installations au reste de l'équipe (présentation orale, documentation technique, etc.),
Étudier et modéliser le fonctionnement des équipements en analysant les données historiques des capteurs / actionneurs collectées,
Détecter des anomalies / pistes d’optimisations sur les équipements du site grâce à l’analyse de la donnée,
Participer à l’amélioration continue des outils d’analyse développés,
Participer au projet de recherche pour optimiser les paramètres de fonctionnement des équipements CVC-R,
Modéliser la consommation des sites pour établir les courbes de référence.
Connaissances / Expertises
Expertise CVC
Connaissance des systèmes de régulation CVC
Connaissance des systèmes d'automatisation des bâtiments et des protocoles de communication couramment utilisés
Capacités d'analyse de données utilisant le langage de programmation Python
Maîtrise de divers algorithmes d'optimisation et technologies de base de data-science, et de modélisation physique
Anglais courant
Contrat
CDI temps plein
Sur Lyon
Rémunération selon expérience
Rejoindre BeeBryte, c’est :
🌍 Participer activement à l'effort de sobriété énergétique.
💼 Un environnement de travail stimulant, convivial et axé sur l'apprentissage et le partage.
🚀 L'opportunité de voir vos idées prises en compte, avec un accompagnement adapté pour votre développement personnel et professionnel.
