description:
nergizing a new world with Exide Technologies.
Together we show the extraordinary importance of energy for a dynamic life and a better world!
Working with us means being engaged and agile. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to sustainability creates an environment where you can grow your skills and your career. Together we are transforming the energy sector!
Exide Group is on the pulse. Our global shaping role in all things energy – from automotive to industrial solutions – means we are also breaking new ground in e-mobility, cloud-based energy systems and megatrends like 5G!
We are one of the few companies in the world that has been providing energy for all areas of life for 130 years. With research and development centers and numerous production sites in Europe, we stand for innovative technologies, high-quality battery solutions as well as manufacturing and recycling. We are a leading member of all international relevant sustainability association
We are currently looking for a
Quality systems Engineer
, position to be filled on a permanent contract at our plant in Lille.
JOB PURPOSE
Reporting directly to the Quality Manager of the plant, you will be responsible for the supervision of system and customer quality.
The Quality systems Engineer is responsible for coordinating and executing activities to maintain a quality management system in accordance with ISO standards, Exide's own standards and specific customer requirements.
He/she is the direct link between the customer and our company. He/she represents the voice of the customer within Exide and is responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction, supporting problem resolution and ensuring timely responses to resolve customer complaints and issues. He/she ensures compliance with customer requirements in accordance with Exide's policies and follows up on customer audits.
SPECIFIC RESPONSABILITIES AND AUTHORITIES
System Quality Supervision:
Ensure coordination of the management system through clear ownership by all local managers.
Ensure the definition, implementation and maintenance of the local management system - linked to the European management system (BMS).
Be responsible for the implementation and follow-up of internal and external audits (system, process and product).
Coordinate the definition and the follow-up of corrective and preventive action plans following internal and external audits.
Lead awareness-raising activities and trainings throughout the plant in accordance with management systems, customer requirements, quality standards and ISO references.
Review, analyse and report quality system data to identify trends and corrective and preventive actions.
Report KPIs, management system performance and improvement needs to management (local and central) and participate in the management review process.
Participate in problem solving and continuous improvement methodology working groups (FMEA, 8D, ECN).
Request the competent authority to stop the process or product in case of non-conformity.
Customer Quality Supervision:
Understand customer requirements and provide appropriate preventive and corrective action plans and follow up tests.
Prepare, participate and follow up on customer audits.
Lead awareness-raising activities and trainings according to customer requirements.
Be a "Quality Leader" for a specific OE customer if appointed by the central quality team / CQM team.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR
You have a higher education degree in quality, and have several years' successful experience in the quality sector, and more specifically in the management of the quality system.
You are able to propose solutions for improving day-to-day operations. In addition, you are orderly, methodical and able to manage several files simultaneously while guaranteeing reliability in your work.
You like to work closely with different functions and are concerned with the customer satisfaction.
You are familiar with ISO 9001, 14001, 50001, OHSAS 18001 and ideally with the IATF standard.
The ability to use IT tools (Pack Office) and English is essential for the successful completion of your assignments.
We are an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity.

Microchip’s nationally-recognized Leadership Passage Programs support career growth where we proudly enroll over a thousand people annually. We take pride in our commitment to employee development, values-based decision making, and strong sense of community, driven by our Vision, Mission, and 11 Guiding Values; we affectionately refer to it as the
Aggregate System
and it’s won us countless awards for diversity and workplace excellence.
Our company is built by dedicated team players who love to challenge the status quo; we did not achieve record revenue and over 30 years of quarterly profitability without a great team dedicated to empowering innovation. People like you.
Visit our careers page to see what exciting opportunities and company perks await!
Job Description
Reporting to the Principal Process Engineer, you will be part of the design engineering team as a “Product Engineer” specialized in power modules assembly.
You will manage product transfer from our design center to the manufacturing sites (Offshore).
Your mission will be to develop fabrication methods and to document SOW (Statement Of Work) based on fabrication techniques defined by the process team (for more repeatability, better productivity, and improved yields)
What’s attractive about this opportunity?
As leader of new product introduction, main objective is to ensure that the products are manufactured as defined by R&D (product specification and process) and within operational goals (yield, cycle time, cost, quality…)
This Position Will Allow You To
Check and approve drawings and instructions from R&D
Define assembly methods and procedures based upon instructions from R&D and process.
Define assembly instructions.
Define assembly tooling needs, participate, and validate their design and procure the material.
Supervise the assembly of first parts.
Provide feedback to R&D and supervise FAE (First Article Evaluation) for first production manufacturing.
You Will Also Be Involved In Product Manufacturing Transfer
Procure requested assembly tools.
Develop competencies of subcontractors mainly based in Philippines (manufacturing methods transfer, SoW verification and approval, operators training, audits). Business trip on regular basis.
Follow up on first parts assembly and approve FAE reports.
You will also participate to transverse activities like (support activities):
Train, maintain and improve knowledge of prototype assembly operators.
Participate in the evaluation and incoming inspection of new material.
Follow up the manufacturing data, participate in the rejects analysis to increase production yields (quality meeting).
Participate in failure analysis and implement corrective actions when appropriate.
Define and implement actions to maintain products within manufacturing life cycle.
Organize the maintenance of manufacturing equipment (test not included).
Schedule and record calibration of equipment’s for control, measure, and trials (except test).
Requirements/Qualifications
Qualifications and Experience
Bac +5 or equivalent (sciences & technologies)
Competencies
Nice to have knowledge regarding power modules and electronic circuits manufacturing techniques.
Good knowledge of Excel, Word et Outlook et Power Point.
Good level in English (spoken and written)
Travel Time
0% - 25%

description:
Who we are?
HarfangLab
is a
cybersecurity scale-up
, and we have developed an
Endpoint Detection and Response
(EDR) software to
detect and mitigate modern cyberattacks
on a company's workstations and servers. Our algorithms detect abnormal behaviors and generate security alerts or block program execution.
From 30 to 90 employees in 2023, HarfangLab is experiencing hypergrowth and has already achieved several significant milestones: winners of the Ministry of Defense's cyber challenge in 2019, recipients of the BPI's I-Nov competition in 2020, and software certified by ANSSI in 2021.
Our initial clients include CAC40 industrial companies and government entities. We completed our
first funding round of €5 million in 2021 and our second funding round of €25 millions in 2023
, which will enable us to strengthen our teams, and to expand internationally in Europe.
Our mission is to
protect businesses and government agencies from modern cybersecurity threats
(cybercrime, data theft, influence)
that endanger the economic health of companies and the security of the nation.
What you will do with us?
You will serve as the liaison between clients and internal teams, acting as the interface for reporting issues, change requests, and information inquiries.
Your responsibilities include:
Providing assistance to clients in resolving encountered anomalies,
Documenting basic anomaly resolution procedures,
Responding to various requests such as enhancements and information inquiries, in accordance with established SLAs,
Tracking and updating requests in designated tracking tools,
Contributing to documentation management by updating and maintaining accurate records.
In parallel with these activities, you will
lead a major project focused on identifying and implementing an AI engine for automating technical support
.
Your tasks for the project include:
Conducting in-depth research on industry best practices and innovations in automated technical support,
Establishing criteria for best-in-class support and specifications, outlining the desired pinnacle of support excellence, determining our target destination, and subsequently drafting the detailed specifications of our objectives,
Identifying, analyzing, and comparing various AI engines,
Selecting and implementing the chosen solution,
Collaborating closely with internal teams to seamlessly integrate AI into our support processes.
About You
Hard Skills
You are in the final year of engineering school,
You are a native French speaker and fluent in both written and spoken English,
IT knowledge is a must, and expertise in cybersecurity is a plus.
Soft Skills
Problem solver: You have strong analytical skills, you are creative, and you love solving complex problems,
Fast learner: You are comfortable in any technical environment and are able to quickly learn new things,
Collaborative Team Player: You excel in collaborative environments, valuing teamwork and the collective achievement of goals,
Independent Contributor: You thrive in autonomy, demonstrating the ability to take ownership of projects and tasks. Your self-motivation allows you to navigate and excel in tasks with minimal supervision.
About Us
Our office and Team Life:
Offices located in the heart of Paris, near Bourse (75002),
High-quality equipment based on preferences and needs (PC, Mac, additional screens, etc.),
Thanks to our Office Manager, we regularly organize events such as seminars, happy hours, themed evenings, and more,
An onboarding process to welcome each new colleague with an explanation of the roles and a mentor to support you during your early days!"
A great team that always seeks to improve their skills
And more:
An attractive package: Base salary + profit sharing,
Flexible remote work options,
A mentor to guide you throughout your probationary period,
Health insurance: The best health insurance with Alan and Moka Care, a mental health at work app,
Meal vouchers: We use the Swile card and also have access to a discount platform through our works council,
7 to 11 additional days off (RTT) per year, in addition to the 25 days of paid vacation. GymLib subscription, covered 80% by HarfangLab,
Access to training and events of your choice and according to your professional needs.
The recruitment process
A 30-minutes call with our Talent Acquisition Manager,
A 30-minutes visio interview with the Hiring Manager,
A 1 hour on-site interview + 30 minutes with the team for a team fit assessment,
A psychometric test to assess your motivations and soft skills,
A final HR video appointment to review your soft skills and motivations.

description:
Job Description Summary
As LV Secondary Project Engineer, you will be a part of “LV, Control and Automation” team, reporting directly to the Engineering Manager. You will be a part of a highly motivated and dynamic team of engineers working on the requirements, design, integration, installation, and commissioning Control and Protection Systems for HVDC.
The role gives an excellent opportunity to motivated engineers to expand their project management skills and personal development within an international project organisation delivering complex HVDC projects.
LV Secondary Activities Covers, Among Others
AC Protection Single Line Diagram
HV electrical control and interlocking principles
Technical specifications (control cable, cubicles, …)
Cubicles design
Detailed electrical schematics. Job Description
About GE Grid Solutions
At GE Grid Solutions we are electrifying the world with advanced grid technologies. As leaders in the energy space our goal is to accelerate the transition for a more energy efficient grid to full fill the needs of tomorrow.
With a focus on growth and sustainability GE Grid Solutions plays a pivotable role in integrating Renewables onto the grid to drive to carbon neutral. In Grid Solutions we help enable the transition for a greener more reliable Grid. GE Grid Solutions has the most advanced and comprehensive product and solutions portfolio within the energy sector.
Why We Come To Work
At GE Renewable Energy, our engineers are always up for the challenge - and we’re always driven to find the best solution. Our projects are unique and interesting, and you’ll need to bring a solution-focused, positive approach to each one to do your best. Surrounded by committed, loyal colleagues, if you can dare to bring your ingenuity and desire to make an impact, you’ll be exposed to game-changing, diverse projects that truly allow you to play your part in the energy transition.
What We Offer
Working in an international team which is part of global Engineering HVDC Centre of Excellence within Grid Integration based in Stafford.
A key role in a dynamic, international working environment with a large degree of flexibility of work agreements.
Competitive benefits, and great development opportunities
Roles And Responsibilities
As
LV Secondary Project Engineer
, you will be responsible to lead your project team to deliver your LV secondary project scope, starting from Customer requirements capture till delivery of equipment to the customer.
This Includes The Following Activities
Define and maintain scope for your project based on customer requirements.
Define and maintain the detailed Project Planning Smartsheet aligned with P6 plan.
Lead the team to deliver as per defined execution plan.
Define and maintain Risk Register and escalate high risks to project team.
Review planned hours, Cost-To-Completion hours vs Budgeted hours.
Adhere to the GE HVDC operation rhythm.
Follow the departments standard design practices, engineering reviews and guidelines.
Ensure resources plan in place.
Accountability on the On-Time-Delivery and say-do ratio KPIs for the project.
Raise Change Request when required following a budget deviation or a change of scope.
Report as per the defined operating mechanism the project progress, including achievements, budget status, risks review and resource plan, look ahead.
Represent LV Secondary team during the customer meetings and with GE partners.
Travel as needed to attend customer meeting, witness type testing in presence of customer.
Actively share and learn good practices and lessons learned to implement in the project for better project execution.
Interface with equipment supplier and reviewing in-house designs and those produced by external contractors and analyse a variety of engineering data, documents, and reports.
Support department Continuous Improvement activities.
Required Qualifications
Degree in Electronics/Electrical engineering or related field.
Strong experience in project management: planning, tracking, reporting.
Strong knowledge about Engineering Tools & Processes
Basic knowledge of LV secondary design, preferably in substation/power plant environment.
Strong analytical & critical thinking mindset
Strong problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills
Conflict management skills
Influencing skills
Lean and Continuous Improvement mindset
Availability to travel ~10% of time
Languages: English is required
Desired Qualifications
Basic knowledge of HVDC systems
Experience in developing electrical designs for industrial control systems preferably in substation/power plant environment.
Languages: French

No

description:
Job Offer: Acoustics Engineer (m/f)
Localization: Paris
Position: Full time (French CDI)
Start Date: as soon as possible
About the company:
Kolibri revolutionizes the way we grow and engineer mammalian cells using acoustic waves to unlock the industrial potential of advanced therapies. You can think of it as “playing music to cells”.
Showing 10x increase in yield and 50x reduction in production costs, our patented acoustic-based bioreactors allow our partners in drug development unlock patient access to cell and gene therapies. Being cell-agnostic and scalable, our process has significant potential across a range of high-value biologics - or in the cellular agriculture space more broadly.
Job Description:
As an Acoustics Engineer, you will play a critical role developing our next generation of bioreactors tailored to the production of adeno-associated virus as first step and other cell-based therapeutics in the longer term. This position entails ensuring the company remains at the forefront of innovation with respects to acoustic cell manipulation while collaborating with cross-functional teams to develop our products. Joining an early stage deeptech startup and a multidisciplinary team, you will need to show inventiveness, creativity, and an entrepreneurial mindset.
Your responsibilities will include:
Research and development
Develop, test, and implement acoustic piezoelectric apparatuses generating the acoustic waves exploited withing our bioprocesses
Generate, shape and characterize a large 3D standing acoustic wave, against various perturbations (reflections, fluidic, thermals, particules etc.).
Work hand in hand with the mechanical and electrical team to improve the integration of acoustic transducers in our prototypes
Modelling and simulations
Fully model and document the acoustic wave propagation and stabilization in current prototypes, and improve them into future prototypes and applications, especially along the scaling of these prototypes
Conduct numerical simulations to assist with prototyping development
Experimental design
Plan and design in collaboration with the bioprocess team experiments to study the effects of acoustic forces on cells, plasmids and viral production
Analyze the results to draw meaningful conclusions about the relevance of current approaches and improve them over new prototypes
Troubleshoot experimental setups and optimize processes to achieve desired outcomes
Innovation
Stay updated on the latest developments and breakthroughs in the field of acoustic cell manipulation
Seek opportunities for innovation and propose new research directions or applications
Build upon the company IP strategy in collaboration with our selected firm and CTO through for example patent filings
Qualifications
Must haves:
A PhD or higher education degree in acoustic signal generation and acoustic propagation, acoustophoresis, or a closely related field
Proven experience (minimum of 3 years) in experiment building, prototyping, implementation of acoustic hardware into lab/industrial environment
Strong experimental skills, data analysis proficiency and the ability to troubleshoot and adapt to evolving challenges
Independent and problem-solving mindset
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
A strong publication record and the ability to contribute to scientific advancements in the field
Interest in biotechnology/health & pharma domains
Nice to haves:
Proficiency in acoustic manipulation principles, including knowledge of acoustic, transducers, signal generation, processing or related technologies
Proven experience with acoustics transducers, signal generation and processing
Understanding of finite elements numerical methods for acoustic propagation and analysis
Experience with process control and automation
Experience in applying acoustic waves to microorganisms, especially to mammalian cells

At Dark, we passionately believe that space represents not only a cornerstone of the modern world but also a catalyst for shaping our future. Our mission is clear: to safeguard this invaluable realm by pioneering spacecraft and mission designs for the protection of vital orbits and assets.
That is why we are gathering a team of bright minds to tackle crucial challenges through advanced engineering. Our focus? Velocity. We are kicking in technologies that will enable faster than ever before orbital missions, ushering in a new era defined by unprecedented agility and boundless opportunity.
Joining the mechanical team, you will be responsible for the setup of thermal engineering activities. Synchronizing with a mechanical architect, you will be involved in thermal design, modelling, analysis, and testing of Dark's systems and subsystems.
First Missions
Taking ownership of the thermal modelling activities as the subject matter expert
Setting up the simulation and analysis framework to support our spacecraft developments
Participate in battery dimensioning by quantifying the consumption of the thermal control system during the entire orbital mission
Responsibilities
Identifying thermal architectures during early trade-offs
Thermal analysis of various systems, subsystems, and components (full vehicle, propulsion components, structures, electronics, etc.)
Maturing designs through conceptual, preliminary, and detailed design phases using active and passive thermal control techniques
Interfacing with the mechanical and test teams to evaluate thermal control solutions (material selection, coatings, insulating materials, heaters, etc.)
Generating thermal test plans, supervising test activities, and analysing test results
Documenting your work in a clear manner to inform future tests and analyses
Requirements
5+ years of experience in thermal simulation and analysis
Expertise in thermal modelling through analytical and numerical methods
Proficient user of thermal modelling tools (NX, Thermal Desktop, Systema, ESATAN/RAD, etc.)
Being able to work in a highly iterative environment during early design phases
Applied knowledge of thermal control solutions for orbital vehicles
Hands-on experience with thermal testing (predictions, test specifications according to relevant international standards, guiding instrumentation location, data processing, and test-analysis correlations) is a plus
As we have an international team, knowledge of technical English is required. Fluency in French is a plus
Culture
We recognize that extraordinary work ethics turn mere achievements into triumphs. Hence, we hold each team member accountable for enhancing collaborative performance within Dark by embodying the following skillset:
Methodology - Your ability to clearly define and articulate the steps required to achieve a desired outcome
Relevancy - Your capacity to discern and select the most appropriate course of action based on the prevailing context and circumstances
Results - Consistently obtaining and updating the necessary resources and information to drive towards the intended outcome effectively
Benefits
Join - our core team, poised to expand into a company with hundreds
Engage - in a deeply technical project with high level systems trade-off and long term industrial vision
Learn - every day in an environment driven by continuous improvement
Enjoy - a team rewarding autonomy and uphold high standard at work
Receive - a high competitive salary and bonuses

company: Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone
description:
Image reconstruction and processing pipeline for brain diffusion MR images acquired in utero
Job
: research engineer
Duration
: 18 months
Starting date
: Between July and October 2024
Location
: Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone (INT), Marseille, France
Salary
: [1900; 2500] euros/month after tax, depending on experience.
Job definition:
The MeCA research team (https://meca-brain.org) at INT and the LaTim (LaTIM Brest) at IMT Atlantique have been collaborating for several years on the theme of fetal Magnetic Resonance Imaging and prenatal cortical development. In particular, two projects have been funded on characterizing fetal development in both humans and baboons. The MRI acquisition sequences have been designed to produce similar images across the two populations.
We are looking for a research engineer to join the team and be in charge of image reconstruction and processing of diffusion MRI. Although we have an extensive experience of processing and analyzing this type of images for adult human data, fetal data requires the design of specific pipelines [1].
The applicant will first investigate and test existing pipelines in the literature, such as [2, 3, 4, 5]. He/She will then be in charge of designing, implementing and validating a pipeline optimized for the reconstruction and processing of our diffusion-weighted data acquired in utero (Fig. 1). 30 datasets acquired on baboons and 150 on humans are already available for testing and tuning methods, new data will come as the project progresses.
Context
: The engineer will be supervised by experts in fetal MRI processing from two labs. The Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone (INT) is a large neuroscience institute at Aix-Marseille University that performs fundamental, translational, and clinical research at all scales, on various cognitive functions, and on various models, from rodents to human via different species of primates. Within INT, the MeCA research team is an interdisciplinary team that performs research on the organization and development of the cortex, mostly using MRI. MeCA has a long-lasting expertise in computational neuroanatomy and processing of MR data. INT also owns a MRI
acquisition facility that hosts a state-of-the-art 3T Siemens Prisma with the ability to scan healthy and pathological humans, as well as primates such as marmosets, macaques, and baboons.
Research at IMT Atlantique involves nearly 800 people, including 290 teachers and researchers and 300 PhD students, and is on digital technology, energy and environment. It covers all disciplines (from the physical sciences to humanities and social sciences through those of information and knowledge) and covers all fields of
science and information and communications technology. Research works on early human brain development take place in the laboratory LaTIM, at Brest Campus, in close collaboration with local hospitals. It includes various applications such as image reconstruction or segmentation, simulations of brain folding or electrical source imaging. Finally, a large storage and computing infrastructure is available at INT for all data
preprocessing and analysis.
Required skills
:
Proficiency in Python is necessary.
Previous experience with diffusion MR imaging would be a plus.
A good understanding of deep learning for medical imaging would be appreciated but
not mandatory.

description:
Overall Job Description
Within the framework of projects, the RTP reports to the industrial project manager.
Its scope of work is the one of the industrial capacity project he belongs to (may represent several blocks and several products).
For each block, product and launch phase, his missions are as follows:
Build and update needs for materials, parts and semi-finished products necessary for the testing phases of the industrial project:
Build the detailed expression of needs based on data issued by the «process engineering» team,
Precise, with the support of the “Customer Project Manager” team:
The reference and condition (X-sample, prototype parts/ pre-series/ series) of each sample,
The supplier (internal / external serial / external prototypist),
Converge the cost of needs towards the allocated budget, by proposing optimizations (mutualizations, recoveries, alternatives, etc.).
Supply requirements for all project phases (Pilot site testing, Supplier FAT, Production SAT)
Keep updated the synthesis of material, parts or semi-finished products needs, for the test and ramp-up phases until the switch to serial supply,
The Needs Are Expressed According To
The reference and status (X-sample, prototype parts/ pre-series/ series),
The supplier (internal / external serial / external prototypist),
Quantity (and type of packaging),
The place of delivery (process or GF supplier),
Negotiate delivery schedules with internal and external suppliers,
With the support of the GF Supply Chain and purchasing team, follow up on orders, any internal preparations (storage, packaging, etc.) deliveries and reuses, in line with validated needs.
Contribute to the Launch Budget
Is involved in the good management of its stocks (Entry/ Exit store).
Contributes to the analysis of launch expenses.
He deals with all malfunctions of his scope at the first level and reports the progress of the topics to:
Process leaders,
Scheduling assistants,
Cost deputy,
Launch / Performance Deputy.

description:
Axens Presentation :
Axens group provides a complete range of solutions for the conversion of oil and biomass to cleaner fuels, the production and purification of major petrochemical intermediates, the chemical recycling of plastics, all natural gas treatment and conversion options along with water treatment and carbon capture. The offer includes technologies, equipment, furnaces, modular units, catalysts, adsorbents and related services. Axens is also specialized in Carbon Capture. Axens is ideally positioned to cover the entire value chain, from feasibility study to unit start-up and follow-up throughout the entire unit life cycle. This unique position ensures the highest level of performance with a reduced environmental footprint. Axens global offer is based on highly trained human resources, modern production facilities and an extended global network for industrial, technical supports & commercial services.
Axens combines the friendliness of a company on a human scale and the influence of a multinational environment whose customers are spread over more than 85 countries.
Axens is an IFP Group company.
The New Development & Transformation Business Division Process & Equipment Innovation Department is looking for a
Technology Development Engineer - BioButterfly Project (F/M)
Localisation : Rueil-Malmaison
Presentation of the New Development & Transformation Business Division :
The mission of the New Development & Transformation Business Division is to innovate and develop technologies, products and digital solutions in the new areas in which Axens wishes to grow, in connection with the energy and ecological transition.
Within this Business Division, the Process & Equipment Innovation Department is in charge of new processes and equipment, from the development phases to the commercial launch. In this context, this department is managing the development projects with IFPEN or other R&D partners, the intellectual property and the optimization of the process.
Context :
Axens is developing in cooperation with Michelin and IFPEN a new technology for the production of bio-based butadiene from ethanol. A demonstration unit ("Expérimentateur Pré-Industriel" - EPI) located at Michelin's plant in Bassens, France is currently in operation.
With this project, Axens continues to position itself as a major provider of technologies in the field of bio based chemicals and aims at commercializing a performant technology for the production of sustainable butadiene.
To support this new development and its future commercialization, the NDT BD is looking for a Technology Development Engineer reporting hierarchically to the Technology Development Manager PetroChemicals.
The job is foreseen as a professional parcours, focused first to support the final phase of the development of the BioButterfly technology within the New Development & Transformation BD (duration : approximatively 18 months), before continuing into the commercialization of this technology within the Renewables Product Line /Technology & Technical Support Business Division.
The first part of the job involves working in a transversal project environment, with close contacts with Michelin, IFPEN and several entities within Axens, such as process design & start-up teams, catalyst industrialization teams and technologists in charge of the Biotech portfolio.
Missions :
Your main missions will be as follows:
Follow and supervise the operation activities, in contact with Axens' representative on site (SU adviser).
Critical scrutiny of the EPI performances; ensure the regular reporting of the activities to NDT and TTS project leaders
Contribution to Blank Process Data Book using feedbacks from the performance & operation of the EPI, support to the Process Team in charge of the Generic Process Data Book
Support to commercial activities in close cooperation with the Renewables Product Line : develop marketing support, Participate to pre-commercialization of the technologies
Management of external consultations as needed for specific items of the technology (equipment…)
Contribution to the development , implementation and maintenance of Connect'In tool for BioButterfly process follow-up
Under supervision of Renewables Product Line /Technology & Technical Support Business Division, create tools to be used to establish future Technical Proposal
Knowledge and Required Level:
Being fluent in English is required for this position
Engineer in Chemistry, Chemical Engineer or General Engineer (Master or PhD Degree) with good knowledge in petrochemistry, refining, and/or gas treatment, with an experience of 3 years minimum, either in process design and industrial operations.
Knowledge and critical look on R&D activities is a plus.
Being fluent in English is mandatory.
Finally, availability for short-duration overseas travels is required.
Associated Skills:
You are synthetic, rigorous, and concrete. You have communication skills, both in writing and orally.
You are also expected to possess the skills necessary for critical thinking and problem solving, and a capacity to work under fast-paced environment
You have very good relational contacts as well as qualities to convince, and comfortable to work in team
You are available for short-term travelling, especially to EPI site close to Bordeaux, and to Lyon.
"
At Axens, we challenge stereotypes and clichés.
It is actually the foundation of our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion.
Only your talent and personality matter to us!
"

Conduire des projets vers leur succès, c’est quelque chose qui vous plait ? Ce poste d’Ingénieur projet / PMO (H/F) est fait pour vous ! 🎯
Votre futur environnement :

En tant qu’ingénieur projet et expert PMO, votre rôle sera de comprendre les challenges spécifiques liés à votre environnement, de donner de la capacité d’anticipation à votre client, et de proposer des solutions adaptées au projet. Vous serez orienté services, résultats, et satisfaction client.

Le métier d’ingénieur projet / PMO vous demandera des capacités d’adaptation élevées, un sens du service développé et un professionnalisme de haute qualité.
➡

description:
Company Overview:
MACOM designs and manufactures semiconductor products for Data Center, Telecommunication and Industrial and Defense applications. Headquartered in Lowell, Massachusetts, MACOM has design centers and sales offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia. MACOM is certified to the ISO9001 international quality standard and ISO14001 environmental management standard.
MACOM has more than 65 years of application expertise with multiple design centers, Si, GaAs and InP fabrication, manufacturing, assembly and test, and operational facilities throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. Click here to view our facilities. In addition, MACOM offers foundry services that represents a key core competency within our business.
MACOM sells and distributes products globally via a sales channel comprised of a direct field sales force, authorized sales representatives and leading industry distributors. Our sales team is trained across all of our products to give our customers insights into our entire portfolio.
MACOM is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse workforce. MACOM will not discriminate against any worker or job applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military obligations, or membership in any other category protected under applicable law.
Job Description:
The Product Engineer is responsible for MACOM products from product development kick-off until end of life. The Product Engineer will be responsible for defining production test plans and supporting launching new products into high volume production. This position is part of the product engineering group field application and cooperates with cross-functional teams of Design, Test, Reliability to drive projects to completion.
Primary Job Functions:
New Product Introduction – responsible for product life cycle management.
Understand contributors to the highest level in product quality, cost, and drive cost reductions.
Manage test house qualifications and yield improvements.
Characterization, ATE and probe data analysis.
Developing production and characterization test specifications.
Creating and managing product documentation.
Providing product development support which involves interfacing with Design, Test, Application, Quality Engineering.
Identify new design and product upselling opportunities.
Align customer design requirements with MACOM products and technology
Provide guidance and input for customer proposals.
Develop the product validation environment including hardware and software.
Validate the product in its end application and writing validation reports.
Creation of collaterals such as application notes, product presentations, publications, etc.
Provide training to the sales and marketing organization.
Requires excellent communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work closely and coordinate activities with other functional groups.
Must have excellent analytical and technical skills to find and resolve any product, process, test, and yield issues.
Must be able to work well under pressure, changing priorities, and constant interruptions.
Must be able to multi-task, coordinate meetings, prepare and give technical presentations.
Train customers and distributor FAEs on the benefits and features of MACOM products.
Be an advocate for MACOM products and technology
Required Skills & Experience:
Master’s Degree or PHD in Electronic Engineering.
Solid working knowledge Product Life Cycle.
Considerable experience in techniques for problem isolation/solving, test issue resolution, and yield enhancement.
Knowledge in the field of semiconductors and different design (power amplifier PA, low noise amplifier LNA, Core Chip CC, Mixer, Trans-Impedance Amplifier TIA…)
Knowledge of bench equipment like network analyzers, spectrum analyzers, RF sources, power meters
Statistical methods and tools
Demonstrable project management skills
Desire to learn and develop.
Good communications skills
Excellent problem solving and debug skills
Ability to work in a fast paced, project-oriented team environment.
Team player.
Self-motivated with ability to multi-task and work independently
Desirable Skills
Lab Equipment knowledge related to VNA, Spectrum Analyzer, Digital and Real-Time Oscilloscope.
Understand in troubleshooting HW.
Familiarity with the following software: Python, C, C++, Jupyter,ADS

description:
TechnipFMC is committed to driving real change in the energy industry. Our ambition is to build a sustainable future through relentless innovation and global collaboration – and we want you to be part of it. You’ll be joining a culture that values curiosity, expertise, and ideas as well as diversity, inclusion, and authenticity. Bring your unique energy to our team of more than 20,000 people worldwide, and discover a rewarding, fulfilling, and varied career that you can take in anywhere you want to go.
Job Purpose
The Nîmes site is a centre of excellence for the group. Our engineers work on a variety of subjects, including subsea lines (dynamic and static) and renewable energies, with know-how including hydrodynamics, fluid dynamics, mechanics and coding. In a small sized company atmosphere, our experts provide technical support to the different global sites for their complex projects. They also carry out R&D for the group, developing knowledge, design processes and internal tools.
We are looking for a "Subsea Engineer" to carry out the dimensioning and dynamic analysis of subsea riser & pipeline systems. You preferably have a mechanical and/or hydrodynamic engineering background. Technical knowledge of commercial Finite Element Analysis software (e.g. Abaqus) is required. Knowledge of dynamic analysis tools is a plus (e.g. Orcaflex, Deeplines, etc.). You have a solid basis in coding to create routines to implement specific internal methods (e.g. in Python).
Job Description
The responsibilities of the position include the following:
Review and analyse project specifications, client design proposals and other data to assess the feasibility, suitability and constraints of project designs or applications;
Ensure mastery and development of discipline design tools, based on state-of-the-art engineering methodology and relevant codes and standards;
Perform the necessary studies to develop and design equipment / procedures according to the project objectives, with due regard to the applicable codes and standards;
Ensure the preparation of project deliverables; create and present reports/deliverables detailing results, product features and conclusions drawn from engineering studies.
Report to his/her manager on the progress and on the expected completion of the deliverables.
As a Subsea Engineer, you will report to the Lead Engineer in charge of the project package in Nîmes and to the General Manager of the company. You will work mainly in our Nîmes office, with occasional travel abroad for project meetings and/or seminars. Teleworking is possible according to the agreement in force in the company, with compulsory presence in the offices at least three days a week.
You Are Meant For This Job If
You are preferably a hydrodynamic and/or mechanical engineer.
You enjoy working in a team, sharing your knowledge, developing your colleagues and learning from them. You are autonomous in managing your work while communicating naturally with your team and managers.
You are solution-oriented, your goal will be to help us solve complex problems. You are open-minded, speak professional English and enjoy working in a multicultural environment.
Skills
Additional Skills
Leadership Competencies
Being a global leader in the energy industry requires an inclusive and diverse environment. TechnipFMC promotes diversity, equity, and inclusion by ensuring equal opportunities to all ages, races, ethnicities, religions, sexual orientations, gender expressions, disabilities, or all other pluralities. We celebrate who you are and what you bring. Every voice matters and we encourage you to add to our culture.
TechnipFMC respects the rights and dignity of those it works with and promotes adherence to internationally recognized human rights principles for those in its value chain.

description:
About the job
We are a global offshore geoscience and geotechnical engineering consultancy specialising in marine geophysics and geotechnics, ground modelling, foundation engineering, cables/pipelines, trenching and numerical analyses. We work primarily in the offshore renewable energy and sporadically in the oil and gas industry for clients who design, install, and operate offshore, nearshore, and onshore facilities.
Our team has a strong pipeline of projects and anticipate accelerating growth with the development of wind farms in the North Sea, the Baltic Sea, Mediterranean, United States and on the Asian continent.
We are looking for
experienced geotechnical engineers to join our team in Nanterre (Paris area, France) in senior level roles.
The successful applicant will work alongside existing offshore geoscience and engineering staff to deliver consultancy services for our offshore energy projects.
Those services will include ground characterisation projects, submarine cable engineering, ground modelling, investigation design and supervision, foundation design and installation, supervision, and other various consultancy activities. You will be working either independently or supervised by a more senior engineer, as part of a team or managing teams of geotechnical engineers, engineering geologists, geophysicists, and GIS specialists. You will be given early exposure to client contacts and the freedom to ‘think outside the box’ and, where required, push the boundaries of knowledge in the industry.
You will work with dynamic and entrepreneurial colleagues spread across a range of disciplines.
You will be given the opportunity to contribute to research and development initiatives, participating in international conferences and prepare technical papers.
Who are we looking for?
The ideal candidate will have a master degree in civil engineering and shall demonstrate 5 to 10 years post study, relevant industry experience in ground modelling, foundation engineering and in the application of geotechnical design methods or in support of large infrastructure projects. A PhD degree in geotechnical engineering would be admirable.
Direct experience in geotechnical design of foundations and cables, ground modelling, site investigation, in offshore and in the offshore wind industry is beneficial, although not essential in all cases. Installation, operations and maintenance experience, specially for offshore structures will also be a plus.
The ideal candidate will have a true passion for engineering, geotechnics, structures, and a hunger for knowledge and sharing knowledge and experience with others within the team.
The successful candidate will:
have a record of producing high-quality outputs and work practices, we will then help you develop new ways of reporting and analysing data using methods which are at the forefront of our industry
demonstrate strategic decision-making skills
demonstrate a willingness to continue learning and developing new technical knowledge and business acumen
have a good level of technical experience and strong ability in their area of expertise
show effective management of his/her own work in terms of quality, timescales, utilisation and invoicing
hold good communication skills, initiative and team work
communicate effectively and represent Cathie at client meetings, workshops, presentations and publications
lead and/or contribute to project management activities, including budgets, resources, client liaison, delivery, and QA
always be respectful of fellow colleagues and managers, with a proactive attitude, and strong work ethic
Required technical knowledge:
solid knowledge of soil and rock mechanics and foundation engineering
solid knowledge of ground investigation methodology and interpretation
understanding of structural engineering
demonstrable design experience and working knowledge of applicable regulations, codes of practice and standards in geotechnical and foundation engineering
understanding of advanced laboratory tests (e.g. Cyclic TX/Cyclic DSS, ring shear, resonant column tests)
experience in writing Ground Investigation Reports (GIR) and Geotechnical Design Reports (GDR)
experience in ground investigation campaigns (onshore or offshore) and data interpretation, including ground modelling
experience in the use of industry-standard numerical modelling software such as FLAC, or PLAXIS for modelling soil-structure interaction problems
Additional required knowledge:
experience in management of technical deliverables
ability to write technical/calculation reports in a concise, precise and logical format
strong attention to detail
good interdisciplinary communication skills
ability to think independently and solve problems, applying innovative solutions where required
ability to manage workload and prioritise tasks
passion for geological, geotechnical / civil engineering and the renewable energy sector
Where:
your office will be in Nanterre, in the Paris area; this is a hybrid role, you will be required to be physically in the office, with part of the time remotely
Nice to haves:
offshore client representative experience or site investigation experience if you come from a contractor’s background, current offshore working certificates
expert user of Plaxis, FLAC3D, Abaqus, PFEM, UDEC
knowledge of AGS formats and geotechnical reporting software
experience using Python, Tableau, Power BI
experience in the energy and infrastructure sectors
What we offer:
the opportunity to work for a leading engineering consultancy with a highly-regarded reputation in offshore engineering
a modern and friendly office environment
flexible working arrangements
opportunities for internally provided and external training
mentorship by reputable lead engineers
flexible working hours and locations (mixed work patterns and remote working)
Benefits
competitive salary
company pension scheme
healthcare cover for employee and family through APRIL health (“Assurance Mutuelle")
annual discretionary bonus
contribution to travel daily to main office from home in Paris area (based on NAVIGO)

description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une jeune entreprise française (et singapourienne) à taille humaine et en forte croissance, tournée vers l’innovation et l’international ? 🚀
Vous êtes soucieux(se) des défis énergétiques et environnementaux de notre époque, et vous voulez contribuer concrètement à la sobriété énergétique et à la réduction des émissions de CO2 ? 🌱
Alors rejoignez-nous ! 🌟
Implantée en France (Rennes et Lyon), en Espagne et à Singapour, et forte d’une expertise transdisciplinaire (IT, data-science, génie thermique), BeeBryte propose des services innovants de contrôle prédictif optimal distant 24/7 et de support aux opération & maintenance pour aider nos clients industriels et tertiaires à augmenter l’efficacité énergétique et la performance de leurs systèmes de CVC-R (chauffage, ventilation, climatisation, réfrigération).
Pour cela nous mettons en œuvre une surcouche intelligente, portée par notre plateforme Industrial-IoT, qui exploite les informations profondes des systèmes existants et de leur contexte pour maximiser en permanence leur performance énergétique.
En anticipant besoins et facteurs d’influence, nous permettons à nos clients de réduire efficacement leur empreinte carbone, de circonscrire leurs risques, et de réaliser jusqu’à 40% d’économies sur leurs factures énergétiques.
En tant que
HVAC Optimization Engineer
, vous rendez compte directement au Responsable du service Optimisation au sein du Département Exécution.
Doté de connaissances en Data-Science et ingénierie thermique, d’une compréhension approfondie des techniques d'optimisation, et d’une appétence pour l’innovation, vous êtes responsable de concevoir et mettre en place des algorithmes d’optimisation de la consommation énergétique des bâtiments dans le respect des contraintes techniques du système.
Missions et responsabilités de la fonction
Identifier sur chaque site les équipements qui peuvent être contrôlés, comprendre leur fonctionnement et leurs contraintes opérationnelles (analyse documentaire et visite de site),
Identifier les meilleures pistes d’optimisations à déployer,
En lien avec le service Automatisme, définir les capteurs et actionneurs nécessaires au déploiement de ces optimisations et mener les mises en services sur les sites clients,
Transmettre pour chaque site son expertise du système CVC-R et ses connaissances des installations au reste de l'équipe (présentation orale, documentation technique, etc.),
Étudier et modéliser le fonctionnement des équipements en analysant les données historiques des capteurs / actionneurs collectées,
Détecter des anomalies / pistes d’optimisations sur les équipements du site grâce à l’analyse de la donnée,
Participer à l’amélioration continue des outils d’analyse développés,
Participer au projet de recherche pour optimiser les paramètres de fonctionnement des équipements CVC-R,
Modéliser la consommation des sites pour établir les courbes de référence.
Connaissances / Expertises
Expertise CVC
Connaissance des systèmes de régulation CVC
Connaissance des systèmes d'automatisation des bâtiments et des protocoles de communication couramment utilisés
Capacités d'analyse de données utilisant le langage de programmation Python
Maîtrise de divers algorithmes d'optimisation et technologies de base de data-science, et de modélisation physique
Anglais courant
Contrat
CDI temps plein
Sur Lyon
Rémunération selon expérience
Rejoindre BeeBryte, c’est :
🌍 Participer activement à l'effort de sobriété énergétique.
💼 Un environnement de travail stimulant, convivial et axé sur l'apprentissage et le partage.
🚀 L'opportunité de voir vos idées prises en compte, avec un accompagnement adapté pour votre développement personnel et professionnel.

Votre futur environnement
Bienvenue chez MI-GSO | PCUBED, le leader mondial du conseil en Management de Projet et PMO.
Notre mission au quotidien ? Aider nos clients à transformer leurs plus grandes idées en réalité́.
Pour répondre à cet objectif, et dans le cadre du développement des activités de notre agence niçoise,
nous recrutons notre futur ou future Ingénieur.e projet / PMO
(poste de consultant en CDI).
Vos missions
En tant qu’ingénieur projet et expert PMO
, votre rôle sera de comprendre les challenges spécifiques liés à votre environnement, de donner de la capacité d’anticipation à votre client, et de proposer des solutions adaptées au projet.
Vous serez orienté services, résultats, et satisfaction client.
Vos principaux challenges seront les suivants :
Structurer un projet dès le démarrage (WBS, plan de management de projet…) ;
Planifier et gérer le projet, en transversalité, à travers les aspects coûts, délais et qualité, en élaborant et optimisant les plannings projet ;
Gérer les parties prenantes via une communication régulière et adaptée, notamment dans le cadre de la remontée des points critiques vers la direction projet ;
Elaborer des supports de présentation et de pilotage pour l’animation des réunions d’avancement projet ou programme ;
Animer les reportings projets en pilotant les différents indicateurs de performance, être capable de traiter des bases de données et de rendre leur analyse visuelle (Power BI, Data visualisation) ;
Analyser les écarts et dérives projet, pour proposer des plans d’actions correctifs ;
Identifier les Risques & Opportunités, en déduire leurs potentiels impacts sur le projet et mettre en place des stratégies de réponse.
En tant que consultant MI-GSO | PCUBED, vous aurez l’opportunité́ durant votre parcours de collaborer avec les marques les plus reconnues de nombreux domaines industriels, d’interagir avec des personnes d’horizons différents à travers le monde, d’apprendre et de partager auprès de nos communautés d’expertises, d’exercer des responsabilités et de diriger des projets d’envergure.
Cette expérience vous permettra d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences, de renforcer vos performances, et de devenir un véritable expert et leader en Management de Projet.
Votre profil
Diplômé d'un Bac + 5 idéalement d’une formation Ingénieur ou Mastère Spécialisé
Vous justifiez d'au moins 2 ans d'expérience en gestion de projet dans un environnement industriel
Vous maîtrisez l'anglais et le français ainsi que des outils de gestion de projet (MS Project, Primavera ou Planisware)

description:
At Dark, we passionately believe that space represents not only a cornerstone of the modern world but also a catalyst for shaping our future. Our mission is clear: to safeguard this invaluable realm by pioneering spacecraft and mission designs for the protection of vital orbits and assets.
That is why we are gathering a team of bright minds to tackle crucial challenges through advanced engineering. Our focus? Velocity. We are kicking in technologies that will enable faster than ever before orbital missions, ushering in a new era defined by unprecedented agility and boundless opportunity.
Joining the mechanical team, you will be responsible for the setup of thermal engineering activities. Synchronizing with a mechanical architect, you will be involved in thermal design, modelling, analysis, and testing of Dark's systems and subsystems.
First Missions
Taking ownership of the thermal modelling activities as the subject matter expert
Setting up the simulation and analysis framework to support our spacecraft developments
Participate in battery dimensioning by quantifying the consumption of the thermal control system during the entire orbital mission
Responsibilities
Identifying thermal architectures during early trade-offs
Thermal analysis of various systems, subsystems, and components (full vehicle, propulsion components, structures, electronics, etc.)
Maturing designs through conceptual, preliminary, and detailed design phases using active and passive thermal control techniques
Interfacing with the mechanical and test teams to evaluate thermal control solutions (material selection, coatings, insulating materials, heaters, etc.)
Generating thermal test plans, supervising test activities, and analysing test results
Documenting your work in a clear manner to inform future tests and analyses
Requirements
5+ years of experience in thermal simulation and analysis
Expertise in thermal modelling through analytical and numerical methods
Proficient user of thermal modelling tools (NX, Thermal Desktop, Systema, ESATAN/RAD, etc.)
Being able to work in a highly iterative environment during early design phases
Applied knowledge of thermal control solutions for orbital vehicles
Hands-on experience with thermal testing (predictions, test specifications according to relevant international standards, guiding instrumentation location, data processing, and test-analysis correlations) is a plus
As we have an international team, knowledge of technical English is required. Fluency in French is a plus
Culture
We recognize that extraordinary work ethics turn mere achievements into triumphs. Hence, we hold each team member accountable for enhancing collaborative performance within Dark by embodying the following skillset:
Methodology - Your ability to clearly define and articulate the steps required to achieve a desired outcome
Relevancy - Your capacity to discern and select the most appropriate course of action based on the prevailing context and circumstances
Results - Consistently obtaining and updating the necessary resources and information to drive towards the intended outcome effectively
Benefits
Join - our core team, poised to expand into a company with hundreds
Engage - in a deeply technical project with high level systems trade-off and long term industrial vision
Learn - every day in an environment driven by continuous improvement
Enjoy - a team rewarding autonomy and uphold high standard at work
Receive - a high competitive salary and bonuses

company: Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone
description:
Image reconstruction and processing pipeline for brain diffusion MR images acquired in utero
Job
: research engineer
Duration
: 18 months
Starting date
: Between July and October 2024
Location
: Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone (INT), Marseille, France
Salary
: [1900; 2500] euros/month after tax, depending on experience.
Job definition:
The MeCA research team (https://meca-brain.org) at INT and the LaTim (LaTIM Brest) at IMT Atlantique have been collaborating for several years on the theme of fetal Magnetic Resonance Imaging and prenatal cortical development. In particular, two projects have been funded on characterizing fetal development in both humans and baboons. The MRI acquisition sequences have been designed to produce similar images across the two populations.
We are looking for a research engineer to join the team and be in charge of image reconstruction and processing of diffusion MRI. Although we have an extensive experience of processing and analyzing this type of images for adult human data, fetal data requires the design of specific pipelines [1].
The applicant will first investigate and test existing pipelines in the literature, such as [2, 3, 4, 5]. He/She will then be in charge of designing, implementing and validating a pipeline optimized for the reconstruction and processing of our diffusion-weighted data acquired in utero (Fig. 1). 30 datasets acquired on baboons and 150 on humans are already available for testing and tuning methods, new data will come as the project progresses.
Context
: The engineer will be supervised by experts in fetal MRI processing from two labs. The Institut de Neurosciences de la Timone (INT) is a large neuroscience institute at Aix-Marseille University that performs fundamental, translational, and clinical research at all scales, on various cognitive functions, and on various models, from rodents to human via different species of primates. Within INT, the MeCA research team is an interdisciplinary team that performs research on the organization and development of the cortex, mostly using MRI. MeCA has a long-lasting expertise in computational neuroanatomy and processing of MR data. INT also owns a MRI
acquisition facility that hosts a state-of-the-art 3T Siemens Prisma with the ability to scan healthy and pathological humans, as well as primates such as marmosets, macaques, and baboons.
Research at IMT Atlantique involves nearly 800 people, including 290 teachers and researchers and 300 PhD students, and is on digital technology, energy and environment. It covers all disciplines (from the physical sciences to humanities and social sciences through those of information and knowledge) and covers all fields of
science and information and communications technology. Research works on early human brain development take place in the laboratory LaTIM, at Brest Campus, in close collaboration with local hospitals. It includes various applications such as image reconstruction or segmentation, simulations of brain folding or electrical source imaging. Finally, a large storage and computing infrastructure is available at INT for all data
preprocessing and analysis.
Required skills
:
Proficiency in Python is necessary.
Previous experience with diffusion MR imaging would be a plus.
A good understanding of deep learning for medical imaging would be appreciated but
not mandatory.

description:
Axens Presentation :
Axens group provides a complete range of solutions for the conversion of oil and biomass to cleaner fuels, the production and purification of major petrochemical intermediates, the chemical recycling of plastics, all natural gas treatment and conversion options along with water treatment and carbon capture. The offer includes technologies, equipment, furnaces, modular units, catalysts, adsorbents and related services. Axens is also specialized in Carbon Capture. Axens is ideally positioned to cover the entire value chain, from feasibility study to unit start-up and follow-up throughout the entire unit life cycle. This unique position ensures the highest level of performance with a reduced environmental footprint. Axens global offer is based on highly trained human resources, modern production facilities and an extended global network for industrial, technical supports & commercial services.
Axens combines the friendliness of a company on a human scale and the influence of a multinational environment whose customers are spread over more than 85 countries.
Axens is an IFP Group company.
The New Development & Transformation Business Division Process & Equipment Innovation Department is looking for a
Technology Development Engineer - BioButterfly Project (F/M)
Localisation : Rueil-Malmaison
Presentation of the New Development & Transformation Business Division :
The mission of the New Development & Transformation Business Division is to innovate and develop technologies, products and digital solutions in the new areas in which Axens wishes to grow, in connection with the energy and ecological transition.
Within this Business Division, the Process & Equipment Innovation Department is in charge of new processes and equipment, from the development phases to the commercial launch. In this context, this department is managing the development projects with IFPEN or other R&D partners, the intellectual property and the optimization of the process.
Context :
Axens is developing in cooperation with Michelin and IFPEN a new technology for the production of bio-based butadiene from ethanol. A demonstration unit ("Expérimentateur Pré-Industriel" - EPI) located at Michelin's plant in Bassens, France is currently in operation.
With this project, Axens continues to position itself as a major provider of technologies in the field of bio based chemicals and aims at commercializing a performant technology for the production of sustainable butadiene.
To support this new development and its future commercialization, the NDT BD is looking for a Technology Development Engineer reporting hierarchically to the Technology Development Manager PetroChemicals.
The job is foreseen as a professional parcours, focused first to support the final phase of the development of the BioButterfly technology within the New Development & Transformation BD (duration : approximatively 18 months), before continuing into the commercialization of this technology within the Renewables Product Line /Technology & Technical Support Business Division.
The first part of the job involves working in a transversal project environment, with close contacts with Michelin, IFPEN and several entities within Axens, such as process design & start-up teams, catalyst industrialization teams and technologists in charge of the Biotech portfolio.
Missions :
Your main missions will be as follows:
Follow and supervise the operation activities, in contact with Axens' representative on site (SU adviser).
Critical scrutiny of the EPI performances; ensure the regular reporting of the activities to NDT and TTS project leaders
Contribution to Blank Process Data Book using feedbacks from the performance & operation of the EPI, support to the Process Team in charge of the Generic Process Data Book
Support to commercial activities in close cooperation with the Renewables Product Line : develop marketing support, Participate to pre-commercialization of the technologies
Management of external consultations as needed for specific items of the technology (equipment…)
Contribution to the development , implementation and maintenance of Connect'In tool for BioButterfly process follow-up
Under supervision of Renewables Product Line /Technology & Technical Support Business Division, create tools to be used to establish future Technical Proposal
Knowledge and Required Level:
Being fluent in English is required for this position
Engineer in Chemistry, Chemical Engineer or General Engineer (Master or PhD Degree) with good knowledge in petrochemistry, refining, and/or gas treatment, with an experience of 3 years minimum, either in process design and industrial operations.
Knowledge and critical look on R&D activities is a plus.
Being fluent in English is mandatory.
Finally, availability for short-duration overseas travels is required.
Associated Skills:
You are synthetic, rigorous, and concrete. You have communication skills, both in writing and orally.
You are also expected to possess the skills necessary for critical thinking and problem solving, and a capacity to work under fast-paced environment
You have very good relational contacts as well as qualities to convince, and comfortable to work in team
You are available for short-term travelling, especially to EPI site close to Bordeaux, and to Lyon.
"
At Axens, we challenge stereotypes and clichés.
It is actually the foundation of our commitment to Diversity & Inclusion.
Only your talent and personality matter to us!
"

MIGSO-PCUBED
est un leader mondial dans le domaine de la gestion de projets industriels. Avec une équipe internationale de plus de 3 000 collaborateurs, nous travaillons main dans la main avec nos clients pour accomplir des projets d’envergure dans des domaines tels que l'aéronautique, la défense, l'automobile, les transports, les services financiers, l'énergie et les organisations gouvernementales. Notre mission est de donner vie aux idées et de les transformer en projets concrets
Nos valeurs
Chez MIGSO-PCUBED, nos valeurs d'engagement, d'excellence, et d'esprit d'équipe sont au cœur de notre identité. Nous avançons ensemble, repoussant les limites pour être partenaires de votre réussite. Animés par la passion, nous visons l'excellence et cultivons un véritable esprit d'équipe, partageant expériences et moments mémorables. Rejoindre MIGSO-PCUBED, c'est s'engager dans une aventure collective où chacun joue un rôle clé.
📋
Vos missions
En tant qu’ingénieur projet et expert PMO, votre rôle sera de comprendre les challenges spécifiques liés à votre environnement, de donner de la capacité d’anticipation à votre client, et de proposer des solutions adaptées au projet. Vous serez orienté services, résultats, et satisfaction client.
Vos principaux challenges seront les suivants :
·
Structurer un projet dès le démarrage (WBS, plan de management de projet…) ;
·
Planifier et gérer le projet, en transversalité, à travers les aspects coûts, délais et qualité, en élaborant et optimisant les plannings projet ;
·
Gérer les parties prenantes via une communication régulière et adaptée, notamment dans le cadre de la remontée des points critiques vers la direction projet ;
·
Elaborer des supports de présentation et de pilotage pour l’animation des réunions d’avancement projet ou programme ;
·
Animer les reportings projets en pilotant les différents indicateurs de performance, être capable de traiter des bases de données et de rendre leur analyse visuelle (Power BI, Data visualisation) ;
·
Analyser les écarts et dérives projet, pour proposer des plans d’actions correctifs ;
·
Identifier les Risques & Opportunités, en déduire leurs potentiels impacts sur le projet et mettre en place des stratégies de réponse. »
Et vous… qui êtes-vous ? 🔎
Le métier d’ingénieur projet/PMO vous demandera des capacités d’adaptation élevées, un sens du service développé et un professionnalisme de haute qualité.
Dans ce cadre-là, votre profil correspond-il à ces critères ?
· Vous êtes diplomé(e) d’un BAC+5, d’une formation ingénieur, ou master/master spécialisé 🎓
·
Vous justifiez d’une première expérience en gestion de projet, dans un environnement industriel
·
Vous maîtrisez l’anglais et le français
·
Vous êtes doté d’un très bon relationnel et souhaitez apporter de la valeur ajoutée dans tout ce que vous entreprenez
·
Vous êtes reconnu pour votre leadership, votre esprit de synthèse
·
Vous savez faire preuve de polyvalence et de curiosité.
Chez MIGSO-PCUBED, nous apprécions particulièrement les personnes authentiques et nous mettons un point d’honneur à recruter des équipes où les talents individuels s’épanouissent grâce à l’émulation et le soutien de chacun.
MIGSO-PCUBED c’est aussi :
🚀Des projets transverses collaboratifs pour élargir son panel de compétences, apprendre, partager et contribuer au rayonnement mondial de l’entreprise.
🙏 Une évolution de carrière qui ne se limite pas à un seul tracé ! Mobilité fonctionnelle, sectorielle ou géographique, de multiples parcours peuvent être imaginés grâce à la Learning Academy MP et ses milliers de formations et certifications.
🏀📋 Des team-buildings & afterworks pour souder les équipes !
Et bien évidemment, plein d’autres avantages comme la prise en charge à 100% de votre abonnement de transport, les tickets restaurants, plusieurs primes (de motivation, de participation, d’ancienneté, de cooptation, d’apporteur d’affaires…), les subventions CSE, RTT et congés supplémentaires d’ancienneté…
Processus d'intégration :
🤝Nous attachons une grande importance à une intégration solide au sein de l'équipe. Tout au long du processus d'intégration, chaque nouveau membre bénéficiera d'un soutien et d'une orientation afin d'assurer une transition réussie.
✅ Processus de recrutement
Une fois votre candidature sélectionnée et votre CV examiné voici les étapes qui constitueront votre parcours de recrutement avec nous.
Étape 1 -
faisons connaissance
: un échange de 30min avec moi, Talent Acquisition Partner.
Étape 2
-
validation de vos expériences
: vous passerez une 1h en visio avec un Business Manager.
Étape 3
-
tester vos compétences
: un cas d'étude à préparer, accueil en agence avec un quizz (30min) + entretien d'1h avec un Responsable d'agence.
Votre profil a été retenu pour cette dernière étape ? Félicitations nous vous enverrons une proposition de collaboration !

This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.
The process control engineer carries out the technical part of a project in compliance with commitments in terms of quality, deadlines and allotted time. This position reports to
Engineering Manager
Your responsibilities
Help choose technical solutions and enhance their value.
Carry out specific developments in line with customer requirements.
Evaluate, select and apply standard techniques and procedures to projects.
Participate in on-site testing and commissioning.
Help maintain existing sites.
Use standard processes and tools applicable to his/her field of activity.

Your background
Minimum of 2 years' higher technical education.
At least 5 years' experience in a general engineering position with a focus on process control.
Knowledge of C++ / C# programming languages. Knowledge of Microsoft Sql Server database.
English and French: good level (read, written and spoken).
No obstacles to travel (20%).
Customer and market orientation, teamwork and collaboration, personal leadership, intercultural sensitivity and effectiveness.

More about us

We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). If you want to discover more about ABB, take another look at our website www.abb.com. Driving integrated solutions that automate, digitalize and electrify industry we connect our people and technology to help our customers adapt and succeed. With over 50 years domain expertise, we continue to innovate and reshape traditional approaches across the energy sector with our technologies designed to improve operational efficiency, reduce risk, reduce energy consumption and waste. description:
We are looking for a
Mechanical Static Engineer
for one of our clients with the following details:
Starting date: ASAP - Q2 2024
Duration: 12 months
Renewable: Yes
Location: Paris, France
Status: Residential
Qualification
Mechanical Engineer with proven experience (> 10 years) with large onshore plants and LNG plants detailed design
Professional experience: several years of proven experience in EPSCC stages of LNG projects, including
The candidate must also have basic knowledge in welding, NDT, and Corrosion engineering.
Good teamwork, with previous team Management desirable
Fluent in English
The Service Holder's Overall Responsibility Is
Accountable for all matters related to the Mechanical/ Piping/ Valve engineering, fit for purpose and with full respect to the Statement of Requirement with approved changes.
Prepares and suggests technical content of essential studies to initiate EPC contractor action and conformity with state of the art in LNG plant design.
Supervises all subcontracted studies and provides support to other packages with the support of Head Quarters specialist.
Ensure PVV choices take into account constructability, operability and flexibility of the facilities
Proposes recommendations on technical deviation requests and keeps updated the documentation related to the Mechanical/ Piping disciplines.
Participates to studies required by third parties as required.
Communicates and applies the H3SE policies of the COMPANY and ensure the engineering is developed accordingly.
Ensures the correct implementation of Company rules and specifications (CR's/ GS's), Project specifications, relevant international standards and any applicable regulations requirements.
Leads the review of the CONTRACTOR' key deliverables such as Mechanical/ Piping studies consolidate comments from the other engineering disciplines and operations.
Provides technical assistance to the project for any technical audits (required by the banks and the insurance companies or Board of Directors, HAZOP, PR…).
Participate, in coordination, with others to the Inspection and Tests Plans (ITP) and FAT preparation and execution. To attend meetings / FATs with Vendors where necessary.
Reports potential impact on overall project strategy, planning and target achievement.
Promotes workshops with the HQ specialist and or contractor's specialist in order to ensure COMPANY concepts and comments are well understood and quickly integrated in technical documents.
Guides CONTRACTOR main design selection in a Fit-for-Purpose approach in order to reach an optimized design. Accordingly, he promotes and follow until approval the deviation request to COMPANY requirements in the main time.
Ensures through efficient review the good respect of the applicable frame of reference.
Participates actively to proper interface management with Process, Safety, Electrical, Instrumentation… studies carried out during the EPSCC phase.
Reviews and comments the key technical documents of the interfacing disciplines such as Process, Safety, instrumentation, rotating machines ... as well as project procedures, if required. Participates to the Project HAZID, HAZOP, PR.
Provides its technical inputs to any contractual discussions with EPC Contractor.
Contributes to the development of the digital plant though the centric data management when applicable.
Participate to Vendors and in particular for LLIs technical evaluation.
Ensure design validity and coherence with other disciplines and throughout the LNG Facilities.
Participates actively to proper interface management
Call for/Participate to interfaces coordination activities and ensure synergies are developed between the different Contractors.
Assist commissioning, start up and Operation team when required. Transfer project knowledge to operations.
Prepare REX and Lessons Learnt all along the FEED.
If Interested Kindly apply.
